The Safer Foundation is a social service provider to individuals with arrest and conviction records. Through a full range of services, including case management, educational instruction and advocacy, we focus on preparing individuals for the world of work by helping them find and keep productive and meaningful employment
 General Summary:

    This role focuses on increasing data integrity, optimizing data management processes, and generating valuable insights that inform evidence-based decision-making. A part of the Systems and Analytics (S&A) team, this position is instrumental in recommending the path from baseline data collection and proactive data cleaning to advanced prescriptive analytics. Working under the guidance of the Senior Director of Research and Innovation, the Data Analyst will collaborate closely with the S&A team, the Supportive Reentry staff, the Policy and Advocacy Department, and external partner agencies. Specifically, the Data Analyst will build a agency model through the Supportive Reentry Network Healthcare Transformation Collaborative pilot (SRNC), which serves individuals reintegrating into the community following their release from the Illinois Department of Corrections and/or Cook County Jail since March 2020.
  
 Performance Results Description


 The Position is properly performed when all essential duties and responsibilities are executed by following the Safer Values.



 Exceeding Expectations, Communication and Collaboration, Integrity, and Evidence Based Innovation.

 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 Stakeholder Interface and Service

 Conduct comprehensive data analysis to uncover meaningful insights and trends, contributing to systems feedback and continuous improvement efforts.
 Support the transition from baseline data collection to advanced prescriptive analytics, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and security.
 Collaborate with the Senior Director of Research and Innovation and others to develop and implement data management strategies and best practices.


 Stakeholder Outreach and Recruitment


 Foster and develop relationships with counterparts in partner organizations and the field to aid in understanding best practices and efficiencies needed.



 Tracking, Document, and Reporting

 Conduct mapping between Salesforce and external documents to facilitate seamless integration of data and ensure consistency across systems.
 Employ statistical techniques to identify patterns, correlations, and predictive models for informed decision- making.
 Utilize data visualization tools to effectively communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders.
 Maintain reports, KPI spreadsheets and dashboards as required.

 Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


 Education and Experience:


 Master’s degree in data science, Statistics, or a related field is preferred. Bachelor's degree in a relevant field required (e.g., data science, statistics, social sciences, or a related discipline).
 4 or more years of experience in managing and analyzing social science survey data, with a focus on advanced analytics (relevant education and project involvement will be considered).


 Demonstrated competency in statistical analysis, including producing and assessing descriptive statistics, evaluating outliers, and handling missing data.


 Expertise in the development, processing, editing, and analysis of social science survey data and large datasets
 Strong proficiency in mapping data between Salesforce and external documents to ensure seamless integration and data consistency.
 Familiarity with data governance principles and practices to establish data quality standards and protocols.
 Advanced skills in technical report writing, editing, and creating visually compelling charts, graphs, and tables.
 Proven ability to identify and address data quality issues, apply sample design and rules, and develop data cleaning protocols.
 Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate in a team environment.
 Highly self-directed, organized, and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
 Experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create interactive dashboards and visual representations of data insights preferred.
 Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or R preferred.
 Familiarity with data security and privacy regulations, ensuring compliance in data handling and sharing processes preferred.

 Safer Foundation is a drug-free workplace.
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action/Minorities/Females/Veterans
 www.saferfoundation.org
 No Phone Calls Please

In 2016, we founded 
   Provi as an innovative ordering solution, aimed to disrupt the 
   240-billion dollar alcohol industry with a product that would move beyond the constant chaos: the texts, paper stacks, missed phone calls and lost communication that has dominated the purchasing workflow between buyers and distributors for decades.
  


 Today, Provi is better than ever. We’ve created a best-in-class ordering solution that better connects beverage alcohol professionals across 35 states and growing, with more than 750,000 product listings that make up the most expansive and trusted database of U.S. distributor portfolios.
  


 We are looking for an experienced
    Data Analyst to join our Data as a Service (DAAS) team. The team’s goal is to leverage the data and insights that our marketplace generates to enable companies across the alcohol and beverage industry to achieve their business goals. This is a 0 to 1 product for Provi and we are a scrappy, customer-oriented, and data-driven team.
  


 Do you want to empower innovative changes with data? If using tools like SQL, Tableau, and Python to solve challenging problems is your idea of fun, then keep reading. We have a modern tech stack that uses DBT, Snowflake, and Tableau. 
  



Responsibilities: 


End-to-end ownership of the data architecture and infrastructure that powers our DAAS product for clients.
 Development of alerting and data quality controls to ensure that data presented to clients is of the highest fidelity.
 Design and develop externally facing modules that solve specific use cases for clients in a scalable and efficient manner.
 Build out advanced insights tools that enable sophisticated and automated analysis for non-technical clients. This could include leveraging cluster analysis, propensity scoring, generative AI models, or other ML techniques.
 Be a strategic partner with the product, analytics, and business team ensuring that we are in alignment on product and business strategy.






Requirements: 


5+ years of experience in an analytical role with 3+ years of experience working in a data-oriented programming language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Scala, etc.),
 Advance proficiency in Tableau and data transformation tools (e.g. DBT).
 A demonstrated ability to quickly learn and master new analytical tools and apply them in innovative ways.
 A strong communicator who is adept at explaining complex topics to non-technical audiences and can develop and deepen strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders. You have experience partnering closely with executive leadership and external customers.
 Comfortable with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process. You connect the dots across business needs and independently drive projects forward.
 Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics, or related field or equivalent experience.
 Experience in a SAAS or DAAS business
 Experience with online marketplaces and online advertising
 Experience with k-means clustering, propensity modeling, and other ML techniques






   $100,000 - $150,000 a year
  



   Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. But guess what? No one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. Trust your experience and apply!
  


 What you can do at Provi:
  


 Make an impact: Work directly with the management team to help grow the business.
  

 Find your groove and grow: Provi keeps growing and you should too. Expand your skill set, diversify your experience and develop along with us.
  

 Enjoy competitive benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, 401K with match, Commuter Perks, Long/Short Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, Unlimited PTO and ½ day Fridays in the Summer.
  

 Be a part of something big: Join a dynamic and innovative team that is working to change a major industry.
   




   Provi is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

 Base salary is one component of BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package for employees, which may include performance-based incentives, commissions or discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: www.bmousbenefits.com.
We’re here to help
 At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
 As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/us/en 
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
 Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. job_title: Documentation Analyst with Data Modelling background
job_description:
Join "Team Infinity"…Lets Grow Together...





Documentation Analyst with Data Modelling background




Job Description



We are looking for a Documentation Analyst with experience in working in Data Modeling and BI technologies in the Governance, Risk and Compliance domain (GRC Domain).
Must have strong experience in documenting Dimensional Data Models.
Must have good knowledge and experience in Risk management domain in leading Financial Services companies.
Work with modelers and data analytics staff to write and/or edit model technical documentation.
Ensure that documents are complete and include all required elements as stipulated in the Enterprise Model Risk Management policies and procedures and any regulatory requirements.
Edit documents for language, clarity, style, flow, and structure
Document policies, processes and procedures
Critically read prior versions of documentation and validation reports to identify areas for refinement
Attend meetings with modelers to gain insight/background information that will be included in the documentation. Take minutes at these working group or committee meetings.
Work with the Quality Assurance Team to improve the process of review and the quality of documentation.
Provide training to quantitative team on effective writing.



Base location: Chicago, IL

Data Visualization Specialist
About PremiumIQ
PremiumIQ specializes in data analytics for the insurance industry. We help our clients leverage data and advanced analytics to reduce loss ratios, increase revenue, improve claim processing efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction. We provide technical leadership to help insurance companies develop future-proof data solutions and elevate their technology teams. Our singular focus on insurance data analytics enables us to bring unparalleled expertise and value to our clients.
PremiumIQ is a start-up founded by industry veterans, and this is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor and take advantage of growth opportunities.
Who You’ll Work With
Currently, we’re a small core of insurance data analytics experts. As part of our team, you will collaborate closely with out team's experts as well as our clients. We're growth-oriented and plan to be adding team members in the quarters ahead.
About You
As a Data Visualization Specialist, you will play a critical role in leveraging data analytics and visualization tools to drive data-driven decision-making for our clients. Working closely with senior consultants and client teams, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating compelling visualizations, and delivering actionable insights through interactive Power BI dashboards. This position presents an excellent opportunity for talented individuals to develop their analytical and consulting skills within a high-performing and intellectually stimulating environment.
What You’ll Do
Data Analysis and Interpretation:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business challenges and define data requirements.
Perform data discovery on insurance datasets to identify relationships, patterns, anomalies, and value ranges.

BI Dashboard Development:

Create visually stunning and interactive dashboards, often using Power BI, to effectively communicate complex data insights.
Collaborate with clients to gather requirements and translate business needs into compelling visualizations.
Design and implement data models, calculations, and KPIs to support dashboard development.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by conducting thorough data validation and testing.
Write SQL queries to retrieve, manipulate, and aggregate data from relational databases.

Client Engagement and Relationship Management:

Participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to understand client objectives and challenges.
Build strong relationships with client stakeholders by delivering high-quality insights and exceptional client service.
Communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
Support the development of client deliverables, including reports, executive presentations, and recommendations.

Continuous Learning and Professional Development:

Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics, visualization, and consulting.
Develop expertise in advanced analytics techniques, such as machine learning and predictive modeling.
Seek out and actively participate in internal and external training programs to enhance skills and knowledge.
Contribute to knowledge-sharing initiatives by sharing insights, experiences, and industry research.

Qualifications

1-2 years of experience in a data analytics role with heaving reliance on SQL and dashboard tools.
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field and a GPA of 3+.
Strong academic record demonstrating analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools, with hands-on experience in Power BI or similar BI platforms.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying, manipulation, and retrieval from relational databases.
Familiarity with statistical methods, data mining techniques, and data modeling concepts.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and clients.
Proactive mindset with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.
Strong attention to detail, with a commitment to delivering high-quality work within tight deadlines.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Prior experience in management consulting or relevant internships is desirable.

Work Location
Candidates must live near Chicago, Illinois or RTP/Cary, North Carolina.Work is usually remote though travel up to 50% may be required.
Equal Opportunity Employer
PremiumIQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or veteran status.

Job Title Business (Smartsheet) Analyst

In addition to the business deliverables responsibilities, one is expected to expand providing opportunities to work on a wide variety of projects and exposure to different parts of the business. This is an exciting opportunity to be involved in supporting the future growth of the Smartsheet team, developing tools, automating reports and quality data analytics, leading to improved delivery of services to our clients.
  Job Description
 Job Description (Responsibilities specific to the role):
 The successful candidate will collaborate with the business and various stakeholder teams to define innovative technology solutions and process improvements to support business objectives, by clearly documenting business requirements, user stories and/or use cases and helping coordinate solutions using Smartsheet and Power BI definition across various development and operations functions. Specific responsibilities will include:

 Analyze client portfolio data consistency and identify solutions using Smartsheet.
 Monitor, analyze and report production changes, trends, and forecasts.
 Partner closely with program leadership to create executive briefings on key topics.

 Critical thinker/problem solver with logical thought process.
 Strong communication skills, including presentation development and delivery.
 Strong cross-team collaboration skills.
 Strong attention to detail.
 Stakeholder communication and expectation management.

 Skills & Personal Qualities:

 A strong service and delivery mentality required.


 Candidate must actively seek to understand internal and external customers’ needs and perceptions and show a “can do” attitude to make an enabling partner.
 The successful candidate must have strong business acumen and intellectual curiosity.
 An ability to translate client needs into a roadmap and strategy is critical with good collaboration skills are important.
 The successful candidate must be able to offer new ideas and help build support for making significant changes. Fostering an environment for open exchange, asking good questions, and listening to gain input and insight is expected.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills are integral for success.
 Candidate must be a clear and concise communicator and must effectively communicate at Managerial levels and cross-functionally.
 The successful candidate must be a self-starter and able to work in ambiguous situations.
 Given minimal requirements or direction, the candidate must be able to define a path forward and work with the team to make progress, without waiting for specific directions.


 Physical Requirements

 Involves work of a general office nature (on-site or remote); typically includes extended periods of sitting and/or operation of a computer for up to 8 hours a day
 Regularly required to talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to write and type
 Ability to read and understand information and ideas presented orally and in writing
 Ability to speak and, communicate information and ideas in writing and orally so others will understand
 Regularly required to utilize vision abilities, allowing reading of printed material, graphics, and computer displays

Job Description: This role is primarily responsible for analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing data insights for Customer Care ; building expertise with running and using workforce management tools, creating reports, data analysis, and recommending process improvements. They provide quantitative and qualitative team performance analysis and actionable insights to all major functional areas of the company, with primary support being Customer Care.

job_title: Population Health Data Analyst Senior - Remote Online
job_description:
Major Responsibilities:
 Provides decision support analyses and services to Enterprise Population Health Departments, CINs, RBOs and PHOs, and all levels of management to monitor financial and operational performance. Coordinates analyses with Care Management, Finance, Government Programs, Analytics & Innovations, IT, Quality, Clinical Risk Adjustment and other departments. 
Prepares analyses and develops routine and special management reports and reporting tools to support ongoing PHO/CIN/RBO operations, finance, care management, clinical risk adjustment, and department management decision making. Works with administrative and physician leadership (site and system). 
Analyze total cost of care and payer contract performance using any and all data systems available. Makes specific recommendations to management and physician leadership (site and system) based on the results of these analyses. Analyze clinical, financial and quality performance by site, by physician, and by contract. Proactively identify areas for analyses, share the information with physician and administrative leadership. 
Conduct and present analyses that drive improved delivery of value-based care. 
Works with IT partners to diagnose, correct, and validate any issues with the data populating business intelligence tools. 
Creates efficient presentations of quantitative and qualitative information by minimizing text and appropriately incorporating visual displays. For executive level reports, craft a concise written summary of key report conclusions and clearly translate analyses and visualizations into practical and actionable recommendations. Summarizes analytical findings in ways that business leaders and front line clinicians can quickly understand and use to drive performance improvement. 
Assumes responsibility for maintaining current knowledge of government regulations, policies, and trends that affect the health care industry, and independently conduct online research to access documents, pertinent regulations, or to access publicly available datasets. 


Licensure, Registration, and/or Certification Required:
 None Required. 


Education Required:
 Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related field, or 
Bachelor's Degree in Business, or 
Bachelor's Degree in Health Care Administration, or 
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science. 


Experience Required:
 Typically requires 5 years of experience in accounting, finance, or analytics experience in health insurance or healthcare fields. 


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required:
 Ability to utilize query tools to analyze large datasets to glean understanding, derive actionable insights into performance, and measure progress toward strategic initiatives 
Experience analyzing clinical and claims-based data sets across the continuum of care. 
Knowledge of analytic tools to design, create, and maintain powerful visualizations (tables and graphs) and models that illuminate opportunities to improve performance 
Knowledge of value-based payment design and development of performance analytics. 
Working knowledge in healthcare industry, healthcare finances, care management, clinical risk adjustment, and/or physician practices. 
Good project management and time management skills. 
Good interpersonal skills, including ability to communicate at all levels within the organization. 
Advanced computer skills, including the Microsoft Office Suite with focus on Excel and Powerpoint 
Working knowledge of data visualization (Tableau/Power BI) software 
SQL experience preferred 


Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
 THIS POSITION IS FULLY REMOTE 
Position may require some travel. May be exposed to road and weather hazards. 
Generally exposed to normal office environment. 
Operates all equipment necessary to perform the job. 

 This job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. Incumbent may be required to perform other related duties.

The Human Resources Data Analyst is responsible for gathering data, analyzing, and interpreting trends using different techniques. This position requires the ability to extract, report and analyze HR data that is used to communicate information within the organization. The HR Data Analyst will work with HR and business leaders to identify data needs, develop reports, and analyze data in alignment with HR’s Key Results and Baird’s mission.

 This is a hybrid opportunity at our headquarters in Milwaukee, WI with 3 days per week in-office.

 For those outside of the Milwaukee, WI area, there is requirement for travel to Milwaukee once per month 2-3 days each time and dependent on client needs; anticipated at about 25% travel.



 As a Human Resources Data Analyst, you will:





 Collaborate and Build Relationships:




 Collaborate with HR Reporting & Analytics Manager and Director of HR Operations, Technology and Reporting and Analytics to research, recommend and implement HR reporting best practice solutions in alignment with HR strategic initiatives



 Develop critical working relationships with HR, external client groups and associated functional work-teams. 




Be a Data Steward:




 Develop and maintain simple to complex reports and provide support for existing reports. Deliver meaningful metrics and trends via reporting and dashboards for HR and client needs.



 Consult with key stakeholders to identify the desired outcomes they are wanting to drive with data and advise on best practices to achieve.



 Ability to provide analytical support and translate data for clients for the purpose of decision making and improvement activities around our people, culture, and client focus. Communicate this information to company leadership and other stakeholders.



 Analyze the Firms’ Great Place to Work Survey results to look for areas of strength and opportunity, provide trend analysis and make recommendations on areas of focus.



 Support the HR Business Partner and their clients on the Engagement & Inclusion and Pulse survey results and output by looking for areas of strength and opportunity, providing trend analysis, developing easily understood presentations and making recommendations on areas of focus. 




Help Drive Continuous Improvement:




 Participate in identifying and incorporating process improvements and new functionality available in the HRIS platform.



 As an individual contributor, assist in the enhancement of predictive and prescriptive analytics, proactive planning, and data governance modeling in coordination with the HR R&A Manager. 




What makes this opportunity great:



 Unique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnership.
 Help teams analyze results that enables them to easily interpret the insights and make data driven decisions.
 This position offers high visibility of work within HR and with executive leaders.
 Baird offers highly competitive benefits including tuition and continuing education reimbursements and has a strong focus on professional development.




 What we look for:



 Minimum 2 years relevant work experience.
 At least 1 or more years of experience pulling and analyzing data from an HRIS system.
 Proven ability with data management, report writing, dashboard creation, and querying.


 #LI-SB1



 Commitment to Inclusion & Diversity


 Baird is committed to inclusion & diversity for our clients, our associates and the communities where we live and work. This commitment stems from our culture of integrity, genuine concern for others and respect for the individual. We view inclusion & diversity as an ongoing journey – one of shared responsibility, continuous improvement and a focus on progress. We invite you to join us as we work together to foster an environment where diversity unites rather than divides us.

Overview: 
 
 Who We Are:



 National Louis is a 135+ year old university that has been grounded in the values of innovation, access, excellence, and equity from its inception. As an institution we believe in providing access to educational opportunity and that education is our greatest lever for social and economic mobility. We are a student-focused community that is committed to continuous improvement and asks how do we become more “student ready” so that we may better serve our students. We believe that through education we are able to empower change and build healthy communities. Our community works hard in the service of students and supports one another like a family.
 


 What We Offer:



 At National Louis University we offer our employees an innovative environment to work together and inspire the ideas that will make an impact. As our external environment changes, our employees are provided the opportunities and tools needed to grow both personally and professionally to remain successful. NLU employees and dependents are offered a wide range of benefits, including but not limited to, Health Insurance benefits, Retirement benefits, Paid Time Off and Educational Benefits.
 


 What You Will Do:



 National Louis University has set the ambitious goal to increase Hispanic participation and success in graduate programs through building academic supports and networks. A critical aspect of ensuring student and program success is a relentlessly data-driven approach to planning, execution, and continuous improvement in all aspects of the educational experience. This role is funded through our CLAVE grant which aims to promote graduate degree attainment among the Latinx student population. The Data Analyst will collaborate with the Institutional Research Office and the Internal Evaluator to create and maintain a database that specifically focuses on Hispanic graduate students in the institution, including data on the intersecting identities relevant to Hispanic students, for example, immigration status, linguistic background, high school background, gender, race, as well as data on enrollment, retention, and graduation. Will also analyze institutional data to create and publish reports to be disseminated and presented to key university units, stakeholders, and community. This position will report to the Director of HSI Programs while working collaboratively with the Program Evaluator to collect and measure data for each activity and objective to ensure both completion and effectiveness.
 


Essential Responsibilities: 
 
Conducts strategic analyses by querying, cleaning, manipulating, and interpreting data using statistical techniques. 
Collaborates with NLU’s Instructional Research Office, Business Intelligence, and the Program Evaluator to build new data elements into NLU’s central systems in order to effectively understand and analyze data related to CLAVE.
 Develops data collection mechanisms, including surveys, focus groups, and other instruments, in collaboration with the Program Evaluator to effectively track the impact of strategies and practices for increasing Hispanic student participation and success in graduate programs.
 Collaborates with the Program Evaluator to measure data for each activity and objective to ensure both completion and effectiveness.
 Creates and publish reports to be disseminated and presented to key university units, stakeholders, and community on grant outcomes and graduate student outcomes.
 Additional duties as assigned by either the program evaluator, institutional research, or CLAVE.


 Qualifications: 
 
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Education, Statistics, Social Work, Public Policy, Business, or related field.
 1-3 years of experience manipulating large data sets with analytical software and/or coding languages (R, SQL, SAS, etc.)
 Experience working in education or youth services with increased responsibility.
 Experience working with Excel for data manipulation and visualization and with PowerPoint for creating sophisticated presentations.
 Experience working with data visualization/analytical software (Tableau, SAS, PowerBI, etc.)



 NLU Inclusion Statement:



 National Louis University is deeply committed to serving its community, advancing access and equity, and ensuring that all individuals are welcomed and valued. We are dedicated to fostering a culture where diversity, equity, and inclusion remain at the core of who we are. These are more than just words to us: they are truly a way of life for the NLU community. We recognize that differences in abilities, age, ethnicity, gender (identity and expression), race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, and background bring richness to our work environment. We affirm diverse perspectives, innovative contributions, and authentic presentations of self from every member within the NLU community. We believe inclusion is grounded in the actions we intentionally take each day. Our goal is to inspire and empower NLU employees and community members to cultivate an environment where we collectively focus on uplifting and advancing our institutional culture.
 

 Special Instructions: Please Include the following along with your application: - Resume (Required) - Cover Letter (Required) NLU Employees please also submit an Internal Posting Form

Our Story
 At Alight, we believe a company’s success starts with its people.  As a Data Governance Senior Analyst for Alight Retiree Health Solutions (ARHS) Data Governance Office, you will be supporting Alight in its data governance, data quality and data accuracy initiatives. The team strives to provide data governance guidance/policies, data quality metrics, standards, easier understanding of data, as well as identifying opportunities for process improvement. The Data Governance Senior Analyst will have a vital role in the company’s global data governance program. 

What You'll Do:


 This role supports the global data governance framework – ensuring our data is cared for through its complete lifecycle, as an enterprise asset. 
The Analyst partners across the company to ensure data is created, managed, and effectively utilized as trusted enterprise assets – which leads to understood, controlled and reliable data. This position will require a combination of skills, from technical and business acumen to analysis and interpersonal skills.
 Hands-on data stewardship/data curation for ARHS business data, helping us maintain high levels of data governance and quality in our source systems and data lake environments. You live and breathe DATA and do not shy away from the day-to-day effort of working directly with data. You have the tenacity to tackle issues and see them through to their conclusion.
 Conduct detailed analyses of data sets within our source systems and data lake environments.
 Liaise with Technology Solutions to help identify and oversee governance enhancements to source systems and the data lake platform.
 Identify opportunities for improvement throughout the full business process life cycle.
 Play an active role in cross-departmental data and system governance committees.


 What You'll Need:


 Passion in working with and understanding data.
 Minimum 2-3 year's experience in data management, data governance, data quality.
 Ability to understand and apply key data governance concepts.
 Ability to perform complex data analysis, data profiling and creating recommendations for improving data governance and data quality.
 Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.
 Excellent critical thinking skills and ability to navigate ambiguous situations.
 Extreme attention to detail.
 Ability to take initiative and work independently while demonstrating strong teamwork.
 Demonstrated experience in developing SQL querries. 


What We Would Like:

 CRM experience D365 is plus.
 Alation or Collibra experience, are a plus.


 **US Citizenship requirements- as this role supports services provided to the federal government and/or a federal government contractor, proof will be required to verify US citizenship status at time of hire.**

 The Market Data Analyst at S4 Market Data will oversee client projects and be responsible for the overall service delivery of our managed services with respective clients. Handle day-to-day demand management or vendor management and administrative inquiries from internal business units, including but not limited to; data/sourcing requests, contract negotiation, entitlement administration, exchange reporting, moves/adds/changes requests, inventory management, procurement/legal approval, expense allocation, invoices reconciliation, and spend reporting.

Oversee the inventory management process of leavers/joiners, ensure current inventory is accurate and up-to-date. Oversee the reconciliation invoices and validation of monthly allocations/expenses.

 Experience working with Market Data vendors such as Bloomberg, FactSet, Exchanges (NYSE, ICE, etc.).

 Excellent communication and project management skills and experience in working closely with internal client business units and senior stakeholders.
 An entrepreneurial and self-regulating mind-set. Display a high level of time management skills to manage multiple and elaborate requests simultaneously.

As Senior Data Analyst at S&C Electric Company, this position holder will report to the Senior Manager of Data Analytics in Chicago. This position will be focused on identifying, building, and deploying business intelligence (BI) and analytics assets to standardize data analytics and display efforts across U.S. Production Operations. Specifically, this role will be responsible for creating metrics, KPIs, statistics, and other analytic assets using data primarily sourced from S&C’s Manufacturing Operations Management system (MOM). Successful deliverables from this role will drive business recommendations and will include data analysis and visualizations used in descriptive and diagnostic analytics.   The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following: 

Helping gather analytics requirements alongside internal stakeholders. 
Pulling data from a data source (e.g., Oracle) to create metrics and KPIs. 
Analyzing structured and non-structured data to produce descriptive and diagnostic analytics. 
Generating descriptive statistics and data visualizations to solve problems related to S&C manufacturing. 
Contributing metrics, KPIs, analytics, statistics, and/or visualizations to business intelligence assets. 
Presenting analytics summaries and conclusions to audiences at many levels. 
Managing tasks and helping drive a technical project to completion. 
Developing analytics related to a specific product line (e.g., TripSaver) and a process (e.g., Quality). 
Actively contributing to the broader S&C’s analytics body of knowledge. 

To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following: 

Degree in computer science, math, engineering, or related discipline; masters’ degree a plus. 
3-5+ years’ hands-on experience analyzing data and generating insights. 
Advanced Excel skills; familiarity with R and/or Python a plus. 
Intermediate skills presenting data-driven recommendations in simple and accessible formats. 
Introductory Power BI skills with demonstrated experience developing reports and dashboards. 
Experience with projects during all phases from initiation to closure; certification a plus (e.g., PMP). 
Be a driven self-starter who demonstrates high degrees of curiosity and problem solving. 
Basic understanding of manufacturing processes and technologies. 
Commitment to continuous improvement through formal and informal learning (e.g., certifications).

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
 


 Location: 1250 Techny Road, Northbrook, IL 60062
 


 Duties: Design and develop analytics and data insight capabilities to assist business management with financial and market intelligence. Develop high complexity ad-hoc dashboards and reports that meet the existing and emerging reporting and analytical needs of the enterprise. Responsible for the development of analytics to interpret and summarize data findings for financial, operations, and strategic aspects of our business. Develop and modify reports, verify information integrity, and design business intelligence dashboards, performance scorecards, charts and graphs, drill-downs, and dynamic reports to meet new information needs. Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics that provide precise view of business performance. Run SQL queries, provide reports or updates via visualization tools such as Microstrategy or Tableau. Monitor historical and real-time performances of key metrics to detect and report anomalies. Use data analytics to effectively deliver findings to stakeholders. Create pipelines and queries in our data warehouse to analyze large sets of internal data. Collect, aggregate, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to drive insights in business performance. Leverage data to understand our products and processes in depth, identify areas of opportunity, and support projects to drive growth, engagement, and process improvement. Partial remote work from home permitted.

 Job Description
  McDonald’s Global Technology – Data & Analytics team is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst with hands on experience partnering with our business teams to create technically sound business solutions. These solutions will enable and support our effort to enhance every facet of our digital interactions with our customers. As a Senior BA, you will support data-driven decision-making by analyzing business requirements, identifying data needs, and providing actionable insights. You will collaborate with stakeholders from various business functions to understand their analytics needs, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and deliver reports and visualizations that enable data-driven decision-making. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a vital role in leveraging data to drive business growth, improve operational efficiency, and optimize strategic initiatives.
 Responsibilities:

 Collaborating with business stakeholders to gather and document data, analytics and reporting requirements.
 Translating business requirements into data analysis plans and data models.
 Actively facilitate and drive requirements gathering discovery workshops with segment, market, global stakeholders
 Assessing the feasibility, ROI, and financial impact of data-driven initiatives and projects
 Conducting thorough business case analyses and creating compelling presentations to articulate the value proposition of data products
 Support segment and market business teams with business analysis to standardize metrics and key performance indicators used for market reporting and analytics
 Assist segment and market stakeholders in demonstrating enabled solutions’ business value to business partners
 Analyzing complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support decision-making.
 Creating reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate analytical findings to stakeholders.
 Monitoring and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance and identify opportunities for improvement.
 Conducting ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data analysis to answer business questions and address specific challenges.
 Providing recommendations for process improvements and data-driven strategies based on analytical insights.
 Participating in data modeling and design discussions to support the development of data solutions.
 Conducting user acceptance testing (UAT) to validate data and analytics solutions against business requirements.
 Create and maintain User Stories in JIRA and participate in agile scrum ceremonies
 Maintain detailed knowledge of the key business processes and systems and identify integration, alignment and improvement opportunities
 Conducting market research and competitive analysis to identify industry trends and best practices related to data-driven business strategies
 Providing recommendations on data product prioritization based on business and financial value
 Staying updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.
 Ability and flexibility to coordinate and work with teams distributed across time zones, as needed. For instance, early morning/late evening hours to coordinate with teams in India




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
 Solid understanding of business processes and ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
 8-10 years’ of active experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent role
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex data sets and synthesizing data insights into actionable recommendations
 Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
 Experienced with Agile/Scrum ways of working, and hands-on with collaboration tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
 Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively convey analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
 Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
 Attention to detail and a strong commitment to delivering high-quality results.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in cross- functional teams.

Job Summary

The PatientPoint Data and Analytics team is in an exciting season of building and growing its offerings for internal business partners and external clients. We are actively looking to add an experienced Data Visualization Analyst to our already engaged and committed team.

Create and edit visual content including maps, charts, and graphs.

Collaboration with data modelers to create naming standards, data column organization, and documentation to create governed data sources to be used for business partner self-service data access and out of box visuals.
Creation of standards to be used across PatientPoint visualization platforms and outputs.
Administration of Tableau cloud, user maintenance, and data connection setup and monitoring during business hours and rotating non-core hours as needed.
Work closely with PatientPoint product managers and business partners to develop and promote content including reports, briefs, statues, and visual data.
Work through iterative review cycles to deliver results that meet or exceed user expectations.
Conduct unit tests and development of database queries to analyze the effects and troubleshoot any issues.


What We Need 


3+ years professional experience

Desired Qualifications

Knowledge of the MVC design pattern.

Understanding of healthcare data


What You'll Need to Succeed 


Accuracy and attention to detail.
Time management and organization with ability to work towards deadlines.
Self-motivation, strong ambition, and interest in directly impacting business results.
Ability to collaborate as a team and work independently using established guidelines and processes.
Creative vision, a passion for learning, and willingness to adopt and share new ideas.
Work beyond what is described in your job description as needed.
Excels working in an energetic, change-intensive atmosphere, while producing consistent outcomes.

Introduction





For more than 150 years, the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC) has been a leader in educating the world’s most influential artists, designers and scholars. Located in downtown Chicago with a fine arts graduate program consistently ranking among the top four graduate fine arts programs in the nation by U.S. News and World Report, SAIC provides an interdisciplinary approach to art and design as well as world-class resources, including the Art Institute of Chicago museum, on-campus galleries and state-of-the-art facilities. SAIC’s undergraduate, graduate and post-baccalaureate students have the freedom to take risks and create the bold ideas that transform Chicago and the world—as seen through notable alumni and faculty such as Michelle Grabner, David Sedaris, Elizabeth Murray, Richard Hunt, Georgia O’Keeffe, Cynthia Rowley, Nick Cave, and LeRoy Neiman.






 Position Summary






BASIC FUNCTION:


       Strategically manage, design and model a develop the School of the Art Institute of Chicago’s (SAIC) Data Warehouse. Works with the Executive Director of Student Administrative Systems, the CIO and SAIC’s Data Governance Committee in support of efforts to strengthen SAIC as a data driven institution.
     


 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


       Design, model, manage the SAIC Student data warehouse which includes data from the Student Information System, Learning Management System, Admissions CRM and other systems.
     
 Designs, creates and maintains SSIS packages to populate dimensional data models within SAIC’s SQL Server-based data warehouse,
 Maintain and create packages in SSIS to replicate database tables to capture changes.
 Designs, creates and maintains SSIS packages to implement a star schema model designed in SQL Server.
 Responsible for troubleshooting and maintaining all ETL loads.
 Oversees SQL Server database and servers housing SSIS, data staging and data warehouse environments in coordination with the DBA.
 Responsible for development, troubleshooting and oversight of integrations from Peoplesoft to other systems (Salesforce, EAB, Handshake, etc.). May have to write custom SQL to build loads. Scripting proficiency in Python, Perl, Bash, and Powershell preferred. Using REST API to get and post data. 
Provides strategic input to discussions related to data governance and data decisions. Translates business requirements into technology requirements.
 Meets directly with data consumers and subject matter experts to gather requirements and model fact and dimension tables based on needs. Responsible for maintaining customer relationships and setting and managing expectations. 
Hire, train, supervise and provide technical mentorship to the Integration Specialists and Business Analysts/Administrator. Review applicant materials and conduct interviews; communicate job expectations and policies; ensure ability to perform effectively, and as needed provide professional development and/or corrective action plan. Serve as liaison to senior management for employee complaints and initiatives.






 Qualifications






      Required BS in Information Technology, Computer Science or other relevant degree.
     

       Minimum of three years of relevant experience in Higher Education Technology, SQL & DBA roles (Oracle & SQL Server), Learning Management System and Student Information Integration & Administration (Canvas, Blackboard, Peoplesoft), Windows/ Linux System Administration, and scripting (Bash, Python,Powershell). 
     

      Experience in Data Warehousing experience (Both MS BI and Oracle BI solutions). Advanced experience with SQL needed and proficient in Microsoft BI Stack. 
     
Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Informatics or other relevant degree. Experience with PeopleSoft Campus Solutions.








 Benefits





We offer a competitive, comprehensive benefits package:

Generous paid time off
Paid holidays (up to 14 days)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Generous parental, caregiver, and medical leave benefits
Competitive retirement plan (up to 9% matching contribution)
Tuition remission and Tuition Exchange Program
Great employee discounts
Complimentary general admission to participating cultural institutions

Summary:

The Business Analyst is a contributor to one or more software development teams, partnering with Product Managers to identify, document, and understand business processes and technical requirements. The BA is an expert user of the systems their development team oversees, can write and execute test plans, and produce end-user documentation. Business Analysts may directly lead or support multiple product lines and have a firm grasp of business operations and software functionality for the products they support. Business Analyst responsibilities include gathering requirements to translate business needs into working software, running database queries to help answer operational questions, and utilizing back-office tools to facilitate business operations.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Duties:

Work closely with Product leadership to develop new features
Can troubleshoot technical issues
Participates in our software development practices by gathering requirements and performing user acceptance testing to ensure that new features and functionality meet user needs
Comfortable working with business users to document business workflows and how they intersect with our products
Creates & presents materials that help advance and inform their sprint team
Uses effective presentation skills in formal and informal settings
Comfortable communicating with users of the products they have or are currently developing
Uses A3, SCQA and other methods to present technical ideas and document incidents for the sprint team
Ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations
Asks critical questions to ensure they understand why we do things a certain way
Operates and executes against project assignments with little direction
Discerns risk and issue impact without guidance, and communicates concerns appropriately
Analyzes data to answer broad questions
Identifies when involvement from departments outside of Technology is needed to complete work
Tracks team velocity to understand process bottlenecks
Works directly with users to test and gather feedback on features being delivered
Understands business operations and translates those into requirements for the sprint team
Leads by example with disciplined decision-making and prioritization practices
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree required
2-4+ years’ experience working on or with a software development team
Detail-oriented and process-driven mindset
Can identify and articulate problems in need of solving
Comfortable organizing and analyzing data using SQL
Strong pattern recognition and recall skills
Extremely comfortable using robust software platforms and computer systems
Excellent communication and writing skills
Multi-tasking and context-shifting abilities
Familiarity with real estate industry is a plus

Job Description 

Overview

 About Annalect
  


 Annalect’s 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter — whether that means fostering consumers’ trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it’s most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom’s unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients’ and partners’ data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes.
  


 Annalect’s unique approach to data and technology – one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability – allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients.
  




   Team Overview
  




   We are a team of engaged, data-curious professionals who continuously seek new and improved ways to learn from our extensive data assets. We share ideas, code, outcomes, and credit for our collective efforts. We're looking for explorative, independent data scientists to grow with us as we tackle ever-changing challenges.
  


Qualifications 



   Required Skills And Qualifications
  


 1+ years of relevant experience
 Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering, information management, social sciences, or business/marketing related fields. Advanced quantitative degree or intensive bootcamp experience is preferred.
 Must have hands-on expertise in Python; SQL proficiency preferred as well
 Experience with cloud computing such as AWS or Google Cloud Platform and others


Responsibilities 



   Position Overview
  


 As a member of the Annalect data science team, you will work with client team strategists and media buyers to create solutions that shape the strategic direction of your client’s marketing plans through data-driven insights. You will collaborate with other data scientists to build new utilities, improve methodologies, and explore a wide variety of datasets.
  




   Key Responsibilities:
  


 Exploring and experimenting with a large number of datasets to draw insights and search for client-specific and general solutions
 Uncovering audience insights for clients:
 Guiding non-technical stakeholders in choosing the right analysis to answer open-ended questions
 Independently formulating and executing an analytics plan; iteratively building on client feedback to get to a satisfactory answer
 Translating quantitative results back into actionable insights and interesting storytelling
 Hands-on machine learning and statistical modeling for audience segmentation/extension
 Collaboratively ideating and building tools that process, visualize, and analyze data to share across the organization
 Evaluating new data and tools; quickly learning to navigate new platforms; extract, transform, and load data from various partner cloud storage solutions
 Documenting and sharing knowledge with a wide variety of Annalect and Omnicom teams



 Perks of working at Annalect
  


 Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative and friendly environment, and often host social and learning activities such as game night, speaker series, and so much more!
 Generous PTO policy that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Fridays program, and extended time off during the winter holidays!
 As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a “startup” - we move fast, break things, and innovate.



 Compensation Range: $77,000 to $110,000. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependence Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation, sick, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits.
  


 Annalect, a division of Omnicom Media Group, reaffirms its commitment to the policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and to carrying out this policy at all of its offices. It shall be the policy of Omnicom Media Group to (1) recruit, select, hire, train, promote, pay, discipline and terminate employees in all job classifications without regard to age, race, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, alienage, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other basis upon which discrimination against or harassment of employees or applicants for employment is prohibited under any applicable federal, state or local equal opportunity employment laws and (2) ensure that all personnel actions are administered without discrimination in violation of applicable law.

 Superior communicator with the ability to interact professionally and considerately with client(s), gaining co-operation and respect

 Ability to learn new skills quickly and adapt to a broad range of project types and responsibilities

 Education:

 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance or Business, or an equivalent combination of education and professional experience

job_title: Data Analyst (Bento for Business - Spend Management)
job_description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

 Job Description

 Bento for Business is a subsidiary of U.S. Bank National Association.

 This role as a Data Analyst will:

 Build tables and infrastructure to allow the team to drive the business with actionable insights from data.
 Work on big data/analytics projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company.
 Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis.
 Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action.
 Interprets data and analyze results using various statistical techniques and tools.
 Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions.
 Collaborate with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments.
 Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.



 Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience
 Five to seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience


 Preferred Skills/Experience

 Extensive experience working in Power BI and Tableau (building dashboards from scratch, etc.)
 Extensive experience in SQL (writing queries) and working in a data warehouse environment
 Fintech experience strongly preferred
 Start-up experience preferred
 Financial Services/Banking experience preferred
 Degree or certification focused in analytics desired, but not required
 Strong working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis and interpret data
 Experience in analytics, advanced analytics/statistics, predictive modeling
 Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
 Demonstrated project management skills
 Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

job_title: IT Data Governance and Privacy Analyst II
job_description:
Chicago, IL (Hybrid)
The American Medical Association (AMA) is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians and a non-profit organization. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.
We continuously work to embed equity in our internal practices and are committed to increasing the diversity of our staff across all levels of the organization. We intentionally work to create the right conditions to enable our employees to feel that they can be their authentic selves and fully participate in the life of the enterprise.
We encourage and support professional development for our employees, and we are dedicated to social responsibility. We invite you to learn more about us and we look forward to getting to know you.
We have an opportunity at our corporate offices in Chicago for a IT Data Governance and Privacy Analyst II on our Digital Strategy and Services team. This is a hybrid position reporting into our Chicago, IL office, requiring 2 days a week in the office.
As a IT Data Governance and Privacy Analyst II; you will design, deliver, and support enterprise data management solutions including business and technical data catalog, data marketplace, and data privacy classification policies. Responsible for supporting data privacy automation initiatives that enable and promote privacy by design and self-service analytics across the enterprise. Leverage meaningful, trusted, and protected data to bring groups together. Advise enterprises on improving outcomes leveraging enterprise data assets.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Data Governance

 Execute data governance processes including data use case intake and prioritization process, identification of enterprise data assets, and defining within AMA’s business data catalog.
 Assists with gathering requirements for data governance initiatives and data projects including training and support of data management related topics.
 Facilitate sessions with data stakeholders to collect and document data concepts linked to AMA systems & applications – i.e., business glossary terms, metrics, data quality rules, data transformation logic, usage guidelines, data movement processes and procedures.
 Analyze and document user needs, including existing business processes, workflows; data flows; use case scenarios.
 Assist in the build and refinement of comprehensive definition of business-critical data elements, key performance indicators (KPI) and other business metadata.
 Develop logical and conceptual business data models to support various business functions.
 Proactively research internal and external data sources, identify synergies with other assets, and help identify both challenges and opportunities to streamline data processes and procedures.

 Data Privacy

 Refine and help manage overall individuals’ data rights end to end operational process. 
 Serve as a Onetrust Product subject matter expert for Privacy Automation. Effectively lead cross training of other team members as required.
 Enhance and align as needed data privacy intake webform and process workflow as consumer data privacy regulations continuously evolve.
 Work with data stakeholders for the management of data access and end to end workflow for enterprise data assets.
 Develop and socialize individual data rights reporting and dashboard to data privacy stakeholders across the organization. Modify and publish dashboard enhancements as required.

 May include other responsibilities as assigned
REQUIREMENTS:

   1. Minimum 3+ years of experience working in data management and data governance roles.
 

   2. Minimum 3+ years of experience with documenting, analyzing, and defining data-centric processes. 
 

  3. BA or BS degree in computer science, Management Information Systems, or related field preferred.
 

   4. Ability to understand business challenges and core business functions and connecting those to data and capabilities. 
 

  5. Experience / knowledge of Data Governance / Data Management tools (e.g., informatica data catalog, privacy management) and concepts (metadata, lineage, data quality, etc.) preferred.
 

   6. Strong communication skills needed to express complex technical and statistical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing required.
 

   7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners to drive collaboration and enterprise alignment preferred.
 

   8. Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with internal and external team members to achieve group goals and objectives. Must be able to quickly secure the trust of data stakeholders in relation to an understanding of their data.
 

   9. Ability to take a business problem and break it down into a series of actionable steps that help address any deficiencies or opportunities.
 
 The American Medical Association is located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611 and is convenient to all public transportation in Chicago.
We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.
 


   BUSINESS UNIT DESCRIPTION
 

   The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.
 

   Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:
 

 Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes
 Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost
 Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement



   POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
 

 Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts
 Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes
 Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action
 Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards
 Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices
 Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders



   QUALIFICATIONS
 

 5 years of related work experience in Data Governance
 Broad and comprehensive knowledge and understanding of banking operations and data governance concepts (DCAM preferred)
 Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills
 Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy
 Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings
 Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint
 Ability to work flexibly in a team environment

Position Information
 

   Hiring Manager:
  Assistant Vice President
 
   Department:
  DL - Direct Lending
 

   Department Overview
 

   The Middle Market Lending Team provides senior, one-stop and second lien loans to U.S. middle market companies. The team structures financing solutions with hold positions of up to $700 million. We also underwrite and syndicate senior credit facilities and a proprietary suite of GOLD (unitranche) facilities up to $2 billion. The Middle Market Lending Team has specialty teams in four verticals: Consumer, Restaurant and Retail, Diversified Industries, Healthcare and Software & Technology services. The team has an outstanding track record of closing deals on time and at the agreed-upon terms, utilizing deep industry knowledge to identify, advise on and implement value creation strategies. Key responsibilities include origination and underwriting of loans. The team works closely with all areas of the Firm to ensure seamless execution.
 


   The Direct Lending Middle Office (“DLMO”) Team bridges the gap between front office investment professionals and back-office support teams. The Middle Office manages processes for the Firm and creates / maintains deal and portfolio-level reporting that is used firmwide.
 


   Position Responsibilities
 

   Golub Capital is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to assist in the review and maintenance of key deal information for the Firm, assist in Firm projects and provide support to end users with data quality initiatives.
 


   Position responsibilities include:
 

 Working with the Team to monitor and analyze a diverse portfolio of debt and equity financings
 Inputting borrower’s financial data into the Firm’s credit monitoring database
 Communicating with deal professionals to understand the details of our borrower’s business and financial statements
 Evaluating the Firm’s credit monitoring database and data capabilities and identifying system modifications or changes to current data processes
 Liaising with Investor Reporting Team to respond to specific investor requests



   Candidate Requirements
 

 Qualifications & Experience:


 Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in finance or accounting
 2-4 years of work experience within the Financial Services sector or strong internship experience
 Knowledge and understanding of financial statements including income statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements
 Strong working knowledge of Excel
 Familiar with Microsoft Office desktop and Office365 tools (e.g., Word, SharePoint)
 Extreme attention to detail
 Ability to take initiative and work independently while demonstrating strong teamwork
 Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment, manage time and priorities under pressure and meet deadlines



   Critical Competencies for Success
 

   Our Gold Standards Model defines key behaviors and competencies across 4 dimensions: Leadership, Achieving Results, Personal Effectiveness and Thinking Critically. These behaviors and competencies drive our ability to win together.
 

 Leadership: Role models in this area consistently focus on the right goals and priorities and continually develop themselves and others. Always team players, they influence and engage with others to contribute to a supportive and inclusive culture where all feel welcome.
 Achieving Results: Role models in this area are high achievers who develop careful plans and deliver consistently and effectively. They hold themselves and others accountable for delivering high quality results, and they remove barriers to ensure others can contribute and grow.
 Thinking Critically: Role models in this area understand our business, rely on analytical reasoning and seek diverse perspectives to solve problems. They are forward thinking, anticipating issues and addressing them in advance.
 Personal Effectiveness: Role models in this area build strong relationships, treat others with respect and communicate effectively. They are driven to exceed expectations and are adaptable to changing circumstances.



   The department-specific competencies define the knowledge, skills and abilities that are needed to successfully perform the functional or technical work of this role.
 

 Deal Execution: Evaluates, structures and executes investment opportunities and transactions.
 Relationship Management: Establishes, develops and manages internal and external relationships.
 Portfolio Management: Actively monitors portfolio companies to identify risks and opportunities that may impact overall performance.
 Risk Management: Demonstrates credit acumen by leveraging tools and analyses and interpreting due diligence findings to guide decisions while balancing risks and rewards.
 Financial Analysis: Uses financial analyses to generate insights and support fact-based decision making.
 Competitive Positioning: Demonstrates knowledge of the Firm's capabilities, the Firm’s position in the industry, competitors’ capabilities and end markets. Recognizes implications of knowledge on Firm’s positioning.
 Legal Documentation: Demonstrates knowledge of legal documentation, processes and procedures.



   Compensation & Benefits
  Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Golub Capital offers a full range of benefits which includes medical, dental, vision and 401(k).
 
   Golub Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
