This position is responsible for the development and maintenance of data warehouse and analytical environments to support financial, management and statutory reporting requirements along with enhancing and facilitating corporate decision-making capabilities. 

Responsibilities 

Independently work with business customers and members of the EDS team to create solutions that support reporting, analytic and warehouse needs using the appropriate platforms and tools. 
Analyze business requirements and work with client areas to produce functional specifications for use as reference in creation of reporting and analytical solutions. 
Perform the first level of testing for a new and/or enhanced functionality and provide support for user acceptance testing. 
Analyze source data to understand relationships and determine business rules. 
Assist in designing the data warehouse and assures that data is stored and maintained in consistent formats. 
Create source to target mapping documents to transform the source data into the target warehouse and test final transformations. 
Develop and/or maintain relationships with business customers to identify and acquire additional data sources to incorporate into the warehouse. 
Train and assist users with retrieving data from the warehouse. 
Provide guidance in the creation of reporting and analytical solutions. 


Qualifications

4+ years of experience developing data warehouse solutions preferably within the insurance industry. 
System and database analysis experience 
Sound understanding of data warehouse best practices, relational data structures and dimensional data modeling. 
Strong knowledge of current relational database and big data software and query concepts 
Advanced SQL skills required, TOAD. 
Data warehousing knowledge – RDMS, mainframe is good. 
Jira, Oracle DBMS, Snowflake DMS experience a plus. 
Experience supporting large scale Enterprise Data Warehouses. 
Ability to analyze and solve complex problems and to work independently on multiple tasks. 
Must be able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with technical and non-technical associates.

Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

Summary: 
  The DEI Data Analyst will mine and analyze a broad array of quantitative and qualitative diversity data assets to assist in compiling analyses and develop reports for internal firm requests, client requests, and external publication requests, and help shape DEI strategy. Duties and Responsibilities: 
 
Manage and complete DEI data reports for (1) standard RFP/RFI (typically routed through Marketing), (2) ad-hoc client requests (typically related to hours spent by timekeepers working on matters or overall Firm demographic information), and (3) third party requests (typically legal industry publications and data for awards/recognition).
 Develop data models and review DEI analysis as required to facilitate and complete DEI data requests.
 Create DEI presentations, survey responses, and other communications materials as required, collaborating with other members of the Strategic Planning team to do so.
 Track and monitor the status of all DEI data requests throughout the entire workflow.
 Keep abreast of industry DEI trends and best practices, to guide and improve future staffing models for diverse client teams.
 Utilize external benchmarking tools to monitor Sidley’s progress against the DEI objectives of the firm. 
Proactively build relationships with different stakeholders across the firm.
 Direct communication with key stakeholders about the status of DEI related data requests being driven to completion.
 Evaluate DEI processes and recommend/implement improvements. 
Performs other duties as assigned or as judgment or necessity dictates.

 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the Duties and Responsibilities (Duties) above satisfactorily and meet the requirements below.  The following will also be required of the successful candidate:

 Strong organizational skills

 We are searching for an experienced Solution Design & Data Insights Analyst at our Chicago facility.   Primary Duties and Responsibilities: 
About the job As a Solution Design & Data Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for NewCold's solution design process for customers in new and existing locations throughout North America. You will work directly with Executive and Director level Business Development staff to drive analytics, help build a business case and design innovative customer solutions. You are a strategic thinker who is not afraid to challenge the status quo to help foster growth at NewCold.   What you will be doing? Assist in the solution design process during the business development phase and collaborate with department specialists, Business Development Managers and Site Managers. Partner with Solution Design Managers, Business Development Managers and leadership in developing and validating customer business cases.  Ensure all customer requirements, data and team expectations are known, while translating customer needs in the business development process. Thoughtfully articulate, communicate, and document proposed customer solutions. Manage data analysis, research and reporting for potential and existing NewCold customers.  Use data and research to co-create commercial proposals for new customers and internal and external stakeholders (NewCold executive and investor leadership). Enhance and maintain business environment intelligence; including customer data, competitor overviews, industry, and macro-economic information.  What do you bring to the table? Bachelor's Degree in mathematics, engineering, or related technical degree with 2 years of experience or Master's Degree with 1 year of experience. Background in data analytics or solution design with experience taking a consultative and relationship-oriented approach. Highly analytical with a love for numbers, data and problem solving. Experience with SQL, BI tools and Excel. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Familiar working in a hands-on and fast-paced culture.  Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time. Experience utilizing Microsoft Visio.

Overview:
 

 We are seeking a Senior Data and Marketing Analyst to lead Tricoci’s data driven consumer acquisition and retention efforts and activities. The role will oversee all aspects of data strategy, data science, Business Intelligence, customer insights, campaign analytics, platform strategy, and customer and performance optimization. Outputs include data acquisition and reporting processes, KPI reporting enhancements and consumer targeting initiatives and strategies. While a function of Technology group, this role will work cross functionally with Marketing, Operations, and Finance to ensure data consistency and usability. Metrics will be prepared and communicated with a high-level focus and attention towards impacting the overall operation and sales channels, while executing the vision of a data driven product and services company.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Developing analytics and data strategy, policies, processes, and toolsets that will enable automated reporting, insights generation and the full realization of data as a strategic asset in order to drive business value, insights, and growth.
 Creating strategic growth drivers leveraging consumer data. 
Innovate business intelligence system capabilities, processes, databases and dashboards.
 Streamline data systems and data structures needed to enhance data-driven value creation via automated dashboards, advanced capabilities like data sciences and predictive analytics, and play a leading role in the formulation of internal insights integration, development, communications and execution of the Company’s data strategy.
 Improve consumer spend, acquisition and retention targeting through use of organic and external data sets. 
Develops, implements, and disseminates metrics/KPIs, profitability and outcomes including dashboards and data visualization toolsets from all facets of our business including service, retail, eCommerce and distribution.
 Oversee execution of data and analytics roadmap, including establishing projects for delivery.
 Create data driven presentations to support strategy.
 Perform ad-hoc analysis and reporting as required.
 Other duties as assigned.
 Qualifications: 
 
Proven ability to analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns that drive proposed strategies to that increase account liquidation, revenue, and efficiencies.
 Experience understanding service, retail, and eCommerce guest behavior – guest retention and churn, cohort analysis, and statistical quartiles. 
5+ years of experience within the data analysis field including KPI creation, reporting, data use processes.
 Ability to analyze and report on customer acquisition cost CAC, LTV:CAC, ROAS, etc.
 Proven analytic and quantitative decision-making skills, including significant examples of problem-solving, performing detailed analysis, and developing and communicating recommendations.
 Strong work-ethic, with high degree of self-motivation and ability to work with limited supervision.
 Ability to manage demanding deadlines, changing requirements, and working with various resources or information.
 Ability to manage datasets.
 Excellent level of proficiency with Microsoft Power BI
 Excellent level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Access.
 Preferred proficiency with SQL
 Excited by a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment—able to tackle multiple priorities under tight timelines with the flexibility to pivot when necessary.
 Excellent interpersonal skills; excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Bachelor’s degree.
 Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines.
 Ability to build strong partnerships across the stakeholders within the organization.

Overview: 
 
   Topco Associates is currently seeking an HRIS Operations Data Analyst to join our Human Resources Team in Elk Grove Village, IL. This position will be a hybrid role, with the successful candidate conducting work in our Elk Grove Village office three times per week and virtually twice per week.
 


 Topco's mission is to provide solutions for our member owners, regional retailers and wholesalers, and help them achieve a competitive advantage in the markets they serve. We aspire to develop high-performing teams to resemble the diversity of our members' shopper communities to drive greater innovation and creativity that ultimately enhances our business results and the value Topco provides to its membership.
 


 We have an exciting and challenging new opportunity for a HRIS Operations Data Analyst to join our HR team. This role is a hands-on role where the right candidate will enjoy working in a variety of areas within our HR department. Further the right candidate can build deep technical skills while effectively administering our HRIS system and other various partner platforms (e.g., UKG/UltiPro, engagement survey partner). Additionally, the right candidate enjoys being a reporting guru. For example, this individual will have the ability to analyze relational information queried from our HR platforms and create reports that support HR and other internal stakeholders. In addition, this role will participate in projects as a member or lead depending on the scope and deliverable.
  Responsibilities: 
 
 System Support


 Serve as the UKG/UltiPro system expert and primary point-of-contact for day-to-day support of business processes, integrations, reporting, and dashboards to ensure consistent, high-quality business operations
 Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements for process improvements, and once prioritized, configure, test, and deploy those solutions
 Assist in the review, testing and implementation (if necessary) of system (e.g., UltiPro) upgrades, including researching functionality, identifying areas of impact, conducting testing, and educating the Human Resources and Payroll teams on enhancements
 Serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g., HRIS partner integrations); provide support HR systems integrations
 Maintain awareness of current trends in HRIS tools with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Participate in user group meetings/conferences, as necessary


 Compliance and Reporting


 Ensures 100% compliance with internal and external audits and other federal or state reporting requirements (401K audit). Provide data for and file all Department of Labor and EEOC required filings required for compliance
 Develop end to end reporting and analytics to enable HR Business Partners and Business Leaders to examine and identify trends, provide insights and empower decision making (building dashboards, configurations, delivery and maintenance of reports that highlight turnover, headcount, open positions, etc.) 
Present relevant trends and insights in clear, succinct reports to key stakeholders and demonstrate the implications for the business
 Serve as a reporting subject matter expert for the HR team by documenting processes, conducting knowledge share sessions, and providing oversight to the reporting landscape
 Provide supplementary support for day-to-day HR reporting needs from the business.
 Keep up-to-date of industry trends and new methods in people analytics, data visualization, and HR information systems as well as business processes


 Data Management

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - National Programs, Policy and Risk (NPPR), Supervision & Regulation
job_description:
Company
  Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago
  The Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago’s Wholesale Credit Risk Center (WCRC) uses data, analytics, and models to inform banking supervision. Whether creating analytical tools used for the ongoing monitoring of credit markets or modeling wholesale credit to identify emerging risks, the WCRC applies analysis in innovative ways to help supervise the financial system. As such, the WCRC is looking for an enthusiastic, technically skilled individual who can provide leadership in data management as well as subject matter expertise around available wholesale credit data, including third-party vendors.
 
 Department Overview:
 
 The WCRC, housed within the Supervision and Regulation department, plays a critical role in the Federal Reserve System’s core mission of maintaining a healthy financial system. The Federal Reserve is mandated to foster the stability, integrity, and efficiency of the nation's monetary, financial and payment systems to promote optimal economic performance. This includes a macro-prudential approach to banking supervision. To this end, the WCRC collects and analyzes both bank and industry wholesale credit risk data, provides a horizontal perspective of wholesale credit risk management practices, and supports supervision of capital adequacy and stress testing for wholesale credit exposures. Staff of the WCRC form the core of Federal Reserve System teams that develop loss models for wholesale lending and assess such modeling efforts at systemically important financial institutions. The WCRC also partners with the Federal Reserve Board of Governors to execute SNC examinations.
 

   Your Responsibilities:
 



     Partner with IT and third-party data vendors to design database tables and ETL workflows for end users.
   


     Utilize data mining to extract information from multiple data sets, provide intermediate to complex data analysis and monitor data quality
   


     Develop and implement project plans, timelines, and milestones for moderate to highly complex projects
   


     Consult or serve as a technical expert in assigned area(s) to brainstorm data solutions utilizing domain knowledge for stakeholders
   


     Support and coordinate efforts around controls to ensure data integrity and adherence with requirements and guidelines
   


     Assist in translating business need to design and develop tools, metrics and dashboards for insight and data visualization
   


     Prepare and present both orally and in written form, findings and assessments concerning complex matters or institutions to internal and external stakeholders
   


     Build and maintain strategic work relationships and networks with both internal and external stakeholders, such as other Reserve Banks and the Board of Governors
   


     Serve as a mentor and/or coach; provide technical expertise and constructive feedback; train and help develop staff members
   



   Your Background:
 



     Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
   


     Five or more years of direct work-related experience Knowledge of and experience with databases, programming, and scripting language(s) such as SQL, R, Python, and/or SAS. Experience with cloud-based data systems is a plus. Familiarity with ETL Tools and building data pipelines Ability to understand and execute business processes; ability to apply complex concepts and interdependencies in completing tasks
   


     Demonstrates analytical and problem-solving skills
   


     Demonstrates critical thinking and decision-making abilities along with strong written and oral communication
   


     Demonstrates the ability to provide effective direction or consultation Possesses the ability to coach/guide and provide constructive feedback Possesses strong teamwork skills and the ability to build and work collaboratively within and across work teams Demonstrates the ability to manage time and projects effectively by adjusting quickly to new and different priorities Demonstrates aptitude to leverage relevant technology and software applications Possesses general business acumen
   



   Location:
 

   This position is remote work mode eligible. The hybrid flex work mode is also available if it is a preference to the selected candidate.
 


   What We Offer:
 

   Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, 401k savings plan, retirement plan, paid time off and transit benefit . A continuous learning environment with opportunities to gain new skills and grow your career Onsite gym and subsidized cafeteria
 


   Other Requirements:
 



     Ability and willingness to travel up to 5%
   


     As a condition of employment, Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago employees must comply with the Bank’s ethics rules which generally prohibit employees, their spouses/domestic partners, and minor children from owning securities, such as stock, of banks or savings associations or their affiliates, such as bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies. If you or your spouse/domestic partner or minor child own such securities and would not be willing or able to divest them if you accepted an offer of Bank employment, you should raise this issue with the recruiter for this posting, who can provide you contact information for our ethics official if necessary
   


     This position requires access to confidential supervisory information and/or FOMC information, which is limited to "Protected Individuals" as defined in the U.S. federal immigration law. Protected Individuals include, but are not limited to, U.S. citizens, U.S. nationals, and U.S. permanent residents who either are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization or who have applied for naturalization within the requisite timeframe. Candidates who are not U.S. citizens or U.S. permanent residents may be eligible for the information access required for this position and sponsorship for a work visa, and subsequently for permanent residence, if they sign a declaration of intent to become a U.S. citizen and meet other eligibility requirements. In addition, all candidates must undergo applicable background checks and comply with all applicable information handling rules, and all non-U.S. citizens must sign a declaration of intent to become a U.S. citizen and pursue a path to citizenship.
   



 We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.



   Full Time / Part Time
  Full time
 

   Regular / Temporary
  Regular
 

   Job Exempt (Yes / No)
  Yes
 

   Job Category
 


   Work Shift
  First (United States of America)

The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.

Note: AAOMS headquarters is open, with staff mostly working three days each week at the office and two days each week remotely. Must be able to commute to the office three days per week. This is not a fully remote position. Must be authorized to work in the U.S.


Location

Status

Reports To
CFO/Associate Executive Director, Operations & Business
Overview
The Data Analyst reports to the CFO/Associate Executive Director, Operations & Business and is responsible for supporting the organization’s Association Management System (Personify) and reporting systems. The Data Analyst will develop reports according to business requirements as requested by business units using Crystal Reports and SAP Business Objects.
The Data Analyst will research, analyze, and create simple to complex SQL queries and stored procedures to extract information from the Personify SQL Server database. The Data Analyst will also use Personify developer resources to modify screens and implement simple functionality changes within the AMS including adding fields and modifying views.
Furthermore, the Data Analyst serves as a liaison with Personify support placing support tickets, facilitating answers and deployment of fixes to the database. The Data Analyst will also facilitate integrations between the AMS and external systems.
Finally, the Data Analyst will research, develop, and maintain complex analytics reporting/dashboards (using technologies such as Microsoft Power BI and integrating data from various sources in addition to the AMS), for the Senior Management Team to use for data-driven decision-making.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree with concentration in IT or two to three years related experience and/or training
Working knowledge and experience with SQL Server databases and TSQL queries, triggers, and procedures
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Proficiency with Crystal Reports and SAP Business Objects preferred
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI or similar data analytics software
Experience working with Association Management Systems preferred (preferably Personify)
Excellent written and verbal communications; good interpersonal skills with a customer service focus; ability to communicate effectively with business users in both training capacity as well as to facilitate accurate interpretation of business user requirements
Experience with html, web development technologies, and web application frameworks and content management systems (DNN) preferred
Ability to work independently and to multi-task and set priorities in a flexible manner to address changing needs




Key Accountabilities


Create and modify queries and reports utilizing SQL Server/TSQL, Crystal Reports, and SAP Business Objects. Work directly with departments on requirements for operational reports and data files.
Build and maintain analytical reporting/dashboards.
Perform extraction, transformation, and loading of data from disparate sources and ensure its integrity.
Develop and maintain email notifications including underlying complex data selection stored procedures and html coding.
Assist with database and application upgrades including acceptance testing and implementing new database functionality.
Facilitate integrations between the AMS and external systems.
Develop scripts proactively to monitor and report data integrity.
Using Personify’s development tools, provide user interface and simple functionality enhancements.
Administer configuration of Personify’s public facing eBusiness environment, currently DNN, code provided content in HTML as needed, and troubleshoot issues.
Modify Business Object Universes within AMS to enable other staff to pull reliable data using Business Objects.
Create documentation on processes and procedures used in performance of assigned duties.
Serve as liaison with Personify support.

Perform other similar or related duties as requested or assigned by the CFO/Associate Executive Director, Operations and Business.

Description


 There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?
 We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.
 United's Digital Technology team designs, develops, and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.
 Our Values: At United Airlines, we believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. Our Shared Purpose: "Connecting people. Uniting the world." drives us to be the best airline for our employees, customers, and everyone we serve, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. Our team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. 
With multiple employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities and world-class benefits like health insurance, parental leave, and space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work that will make you feel welcome and accepted. Come join our team and help us make a positive impact on the world.
 Job overview and responsibilities 
The role of the Business Technical Analyst will work as part of the Customer Care Application IT team to support and maintain the systems that are used by our customer care agents. The Analyst will look for opportunities to improve customer care agent’s experiences and productivity through supporting application development. This position will work closely with the applications teams and business owners to support initiatives, application improvements, and management of application releases.

Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners
Clearly articulates and documents business requirements
Translates business requirements into functional requirements applying a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and handling change)
Leads analysis of requirements to determine the systems’ potential and defining the impact to other business units and systems while providing input to the development effort
Maintains project requirements according to requirements management plan
Partners with the business to identify the appropriate data sources and analysis methodology to meet business needs
Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions
Reviews product design documentation to ensure that requirements are accurate, unambiguous, and verifiable
Assists in generating use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are collected
Performs impact analysis and supports application testing, implementation and training activities throughout the process
Works with outside vendors to deliver solutions
Identifies any potential roadblocks on the project and proactively connect with project teams
Gathers, structures, and analyzes data from multiple data sources

Qualifications
 Required 

Bachelor’s Degree with focus on Computer Science or a related area
3-5+ years experience as a business analyst
Data analysis
Good interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills with multiple levels
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work with multi-functional teams to provide data-driven solutions
Ability to aggregate data and produce reports representing status and results
Ability to prioritize, deal with ambiguity, and deliver measurable results in agile, fast-paced environment
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification
Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position

Preferred

Airline industry experience
Experience working in large, multi-platform important IT environments that are sophisticated, diverse, and fast-paced
Knowledge of database technologies and cloud services
Proficient in MS Access and Excel

Career Area: Marketing / Sales / Product Support 
 Job Description: 
At Caterpillar, we work to help our customers build a better world. Without our team of talented, bright, and driven individuals, we wouldn’t be the Caterpillar we are today. Now, this is your chance to join our team and do work that matters. We want you to help us enable customer success, make progress possible around the world and help our communities grow and thrive. 
Global Rental, Service & Marketing (GRSM) is a part of the Services, Distribution & Digital (SD&D) segment. GRSM is comprised of Global Rental & Used Equipment Services, Global Service and Global Marketing & Brand. A primary role of GRSM is to support and enhance Caterpillar’s dealer network, which is a competitive strength and the critical way in which we serve our customers. 
Customer Experience (CX) is about considering our customers’ perspectives in everything we do and the business decisions we make, with the objective of ensuring a mutually beneficial relationship. The Integrated Consumer Experience team (ICX) is a newly formed team for Caterpillar and one that is responsible for implementing global Caterpillar-wide approaches to drive loyalty, retention and meaningful interactions throughout the customer journey. 
We are looking for a talented and passionate team member that will help influence and support the right strategies and business practices to enhance Caterpillar’s reputation and strengthen its relationships with our customers. Members of the ICX team ensure that digital and physical experiences adhere to brand standards and support optimal customer contacts, acquisitions, journeys, and Caterpillar’s revenue generation objectives. 
The Role: Customer Experience Data Analyst 
Cat Vantage Rewards is Caterpillar’s new Loyalty Rewards program. This program is enterprise-wide and works closely with our Caterpillar Dealer network to market, convert and develop awareness to Caterpillar customers. This role will support the customer experience strategy for the enterprise to ensure the brand mission comes to life in the hearts and minds of Caterpillar customers. 
This new program unifies our customers’ rewards experience and enables them to earn reward points based on spend. Cat Vantage Points can be redeemed for Cat Credits to be used towards future qualifying purchases of Cat parts, service, rentals, and more. 
Cat Vantage launched in the US and Canada in 2023, and we will be expanding our NA as well a global Cat Vantage Rewards experiences. We are looking for a Marketing Data specialist that has experience in the following: 

Uses data and insight to drive the strategic direction of Cat Vantage Rewards. Gather data and research from marketing technology, Voice of the Customer, Voice of the Dealer and Business to accelerate business growth. 
Visualize the data to drive clarity of results and report on trends, areas of opportunity and impact. 
Point person to lead training materials and reporting for Customer Service, dealer leadership, dealer network and internal Caterpillar employees to enable those groups to promote and support the loyalty program. 
Provide monthly report of drivers and indicators for Caterpillar business units in concert with marketing campaigns. 
Support defining the Cat Vantage Rewards program key performance indicators (KPI), and program health reporting standards. 
Responsible for program health dashboard reporting, including leveraging data to generate key insights and recommendations which are shared with Cat Vantage Rewards stakeholders and leaders. 
Partner with Customer Experience Insights partners to analyze survey results and generate key insights, recommendations, and action plans. 
Work closely with Rewards leader and International specialist to develop a view of new or emerging opportunities. 
Collaborate with technology partners to ensure that tracking and analytic tools are meeting the needs for reporting. 

Key Skills: 

Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional groups to build reporting dashboards and monthly reporting. 
Analytical thinking: Properly assess data and draw conclusions, identify customer trends and patterns to guide decisions. 
Communications: Clearly convey thoughts and listen to others. 
Problem-solving: Studying issues in the customer experience and identifying solutions to ensure that customers are satisfied with the Cat brand from the moment they show interest to well after purchase. 
Insights generation and ability to story-tell using data: Showcase data to help inform and influence a customer-centric experience and allow the data to drive the design. 
Execution: Strong project management abilities. 

Basic Requirements: 

Bachelor's degree in marketing, marketing analytics and/or research 
5+ years of marketing experience in a large, matrixed organization 
3+ years supporting or participating in customer experience (CX) transformation initiatives and data analytics 
Must be willing to travel up to 20% of working time (mostly domestic travel) 

Top Candidates will also have: 

Knowledge of CX fundamentals. 
Certifications or trainings in CX best-practices. 
Experience in design and execution of market / customer / behavioral research including both qualitative and quantitative. 
Demonstrated experience leading customer journey processes (customer retention, customer service, reporting, etc.) across multiple industries such as automotive, retail, CPG, and hospitality. 
Strong customer focus and ability to incorporate feedback / input from multiple sources. 
Exceptional organization, project management and change management success. 
Experience developing and deploying new insights methods or capability. 
Experience communicating with others in different levels of the organization, including senior leadership and stakeholders. 

Additional Information : 

This posting will expire at 11:59pm CST on Thursday, July 20th. 
This position can be located in Peoria, IL or Chicago, IL. Remote work may be considered for the right candidate. 

This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers 
EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

GG+A Who We Are and What We Do
 Summary
 The firm seeks a detail-oriented Survey Data Analyst to assist in the development and analysis of custom surveys investigating clients’ staff and donor experiences. This is a full-time, onsite position onsite in our Chicago office. Salary range is $60,000 - $75,000 based on experience.
 The Survey Data Analyst is responsible for developing survey instruments, programming surveys into Qualtrics, and analyzing quantitative and qualitative survey responses. The person in this position is also responsible for the following: data analysis and building visualizations of data which can be clearly and effectively communicated to clients, coordinating project workflow and deliverables throughout the life of multiple client projects, communicating with and coordinating activities of multiple project teams, compiling project data, drafting client presentations and reports, drafting or editing correspondence and other duties as required. The Survey Data Analyst will work with all business units across the firm. 
The Survey Data Analyst will be passionate about the mission of the firm, live the core values established by leadership, and support a high performance culture that engages, motivates and focuses the firm’s consulting talent in pursuit of profitable growth.
 Our firm is growing! Please consider applying even if you do not meet all the job preferences or requirements. We routinely work with applicants to best align them with current and future job openings.
 Key Responsibilities
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned.
 Survey Development and Execution

 Collaborate with survey researchers and consultants to develop custom survey instruments
 Advise clients on surveying best practices as needed
 Program surveys into Qualtrics that involve logic and audience segmentation
 Develop respondent correspondence to encourage survey participation
 Track survey responses and adjust correspondence as needed to reach optimal response rates

 Data Analysis 

Analyze quantitative responses to Likert-scale questions segmented by key audience demographics
 Analyze qualitative open-ended responses to identify key themes and areas for further exploration
 Develop reports and presentations using Tableau, R, and Excel
 Optimize existing templates and workbooks to transform, analyze, and report the data through relevant tables and charts
 Provide custom analysis in collaboration with consultants and senior staff as required
 Translate data analysis and visualizations into client-ready reports and presentations
 Provide meticulous ongoing quality assurance of data, analysis, reports, presentations and other deliverables to ensure correct, complete and relevant results
 Share knowledge in technical skill areas with work colleagues, making a positive change and measurable difference to GG+A and client projects.

 Project Support/Management 

Manage time efficiently to ensure availability to meet project team’s expectations for work assignments
 Ensure deliverables follow GG+A style, format, and best practices’ standards.
 Collaborate and communicate with team members
 Follow up with clients, colleagues, and vendors to ensure timely completion of projects and throughput of workflow
 Limited out-of-town travel may be required, though the staff member will work primarily from GG+A’s headquarters in downtown Chicago 

Education and Experience 

Bachelor’s degree required in a quantitative field (such as statistics, math, or data science), social science research, public policy, or other field with relevant work experience
 Minimum of 2 years’ academic and work experience conducting social science research with at least 1 year of direct experience analyzing survey data (Or 1 year academic/work research experience with a graduate degree)
 Working knowledge of Qualtrics or similar survey software platform required
 Working knowledge of MS Excel (formulas, v-lookups, pivot table, charts etc.) required
 Experience with R or similar statistical software required
 Experience with Tableau (visualizations, crosstabs, tables, dashboards etc.) preferred 
Experience and demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite
 Desirable attributes: Diligent, meticulous, detail oriented, curious, ability to switch priorities, collaborative and nimble

 Communication and Relationship Skills 

Demonstrate the mission, vision, values, and culture principles of GG+A 
Ability to establish, cultivate and nurture high value relationships across the organization, and with clients
 Demonstrate motivated initiative with a “can-do” approach for results-oriented outcomes 
Demonstrated pride in teamwork and outcomes 
Demonstrate professional interpersonal skills
 Ability to provide highly valued client-service for both internal and external clients, with focus on continual improvement
 Ability to read and comprehend instructions from written and oral sources 
Ability to write clear, effective, and accurate business correspondence
 Demonstrated comfort presenting to internal and external stakeholders
 Ability to read, write, speak and comprehend English fluently

 Math and Analytic Skills


 Data analysis and experience developing visual depictions of data trends
 Ability to understand mathematical relationships and formulas
 Critical thinking that enables effective data review and ability to generate narrative observations and findings
 Demonstrate an exquisite attention to detail

 Reasoning Ability 

Ability to work independently and know when to seek guidance from leadership
 Good deductive and inductive reasoning skills
 Demonstrated ability to use diplomacy and tact in all communication, written and verbal 
Ability to think analytically and proactively solve problems
 Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects demonstrating structured organization and astute attention to detail
 Demonstrates sound discretion, professional judgement, and business ethics in decision making

 Physical Demands 
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Ability to use office equipment such as computer, keyboard, mouse technology
 Ability to work under pressure to meet exacting deadlines
 Repetitive motion activities such as heavy typing and using a mouse
 Ability to adjust focus quickly from one medium to another
 Attend any/all project meetings and in-person client meetings
 Flexible hours may be required to accommodate global clients


 About GG+A
 GG+A is a full-service philanthropic management consulting firm with 60+ years of industry-defining leadership in helping our clients realize the full potential of their missions through the growth of philanthropic support. Our primary mission is to assist our clients in the substantial improvement and acceleration of their fundraising programs. We seek to align those programs with the institution’s core mission and ensure their sustainability.
 GG+A is an international resource for data-driven best practices in all areas of advancement, including fundraising, engagement, communications, and advancement services. We provide counsel to a global constituency of nonprofits, specifically in the areas of higher education, academic medicine/healthcare, independent schools, arts and culture, select humanitarian institutions, and a range of charities and nonprofit organizations.
 GG+A embodies a high-performance and entrepreneurial culture. We are client-centric, rigorous, creative, and data-driven in our practices, and committed to responding swiftly and effectively to client needs and requirements. We offer a challenging environment and seek intelligent, energetic, and self-motivated individuals who are achievement-oriented and have high integrity.
 
GG+A is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected classifications.

 Chamberlain Advisors is currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for our direct client in the healthcare and retail pharmacy industry. This is a 13-month contract. The ideal candidate will analyze and illustrate data in PowerPoint to tell the story of what is happening at micro fulfillment centers across the organization. Click apply now and join the Chamberlain experience.
 

Summary
 Our client is seeking a contractor to focus on reporting for pharmacy micro-fulfillment sites. They will analyze and illustrate data in PowerPoint to tell the story of what is happening in the business for these sites. The resource will work closely and cross functionally with individuals to obtain the data as well.
 

What You Will Be Accountable For

Providing technical analytics to support Pharmacy Micro-fulfillment center initiative. Provides operational recommendations based on those analytics. Collecting and analyzing performance data and developing business performance reports and analysis that support key decision making. 
Creating and managing various database structures and analytics websites to collect analyze and disseminate operational data. 
Defining, designing, building, and preparing daily, weekly, monthly, user customizable, and adhoc operations reports and analysis for key operational metrics. 
Acts independently to go beyond the request and anticipate the current or future needs of the request to add value or increase functionality/ease of use. 
Helps other analysts on the team. Researches, analyzes, and explains current and past activity, expected trends, and potential effect of change. Presents and supports findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization. 
Develops and reports on highly granular metrics that require an in-depth knowledge of Walgreen pharmacy operations and internal systems such as Intercom Plus and SIMS. 
Evaluates data collected and identifies and interprets trends. Based on findings, prepares and communicates results and recommendations to various levels of senior management. 
Ensures accuracy of all reported data by continually reviewing and analyzing current sources, processes, and systems functions. 
Prepares graphs, spreadsheets, reports, and PowerPoint presentations as required. 
Serves as a subject matter expert on pharmacy performance metrics analysis, design, development, and the execution of queries, business reports and dashboards. 
Uses statistical methodologies to describe and model behaviors, transaction volumes, and performance measures. 
Create and maintain databases, spreadsheets, interactive self-service reporting web front ends, and other tracking mechanisms. 
Collaborates with internal departments to initiate/implement improvements and efficiencies related to analytics needs. 
Creates and maintains tools that will automate analytics, such as web-based reporting. 
Establishes reporting standards and criteria and maintains data and reporting integrity. 
Defines and develops requirements for reporting to all levels within the management structure, and methodology for calculations for metrics and/or analysis. 

What Qualifications You Need

Bachelor’s degree in a technical/quantitative field, IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Science, Economics, etc. with 3+ years of experience in an analytical or pharmacy role OR a High School Diploma/GED and 6+ years of experience in an analytical or pharmacy role 
Strong analytical and problem solving skills 
Experience querying databases, troubleshooting, and resolving issues. 
Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions, time management skills to meet multiple project deadlines, depending on oneself to complete objectives and determining when escalation of issues is necessary. 
Advanced Microsoft Excel (VB macros, nested if statements and other complex functions, advanced pivot table skills, etc. 
Knowledge of Pharmacy and/or Pharmacy applications is a plus 
Prior experience with supply chain is a plus

 Our fortune 20 client is seeking innovative and intelligent individuals to join their team. Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.
 









          Job Description
        









   Position Overview
 

   The Data Analyst, Operations Engineering primarily provides technical support to a large operating fleet of renewable energy projects by transforming data into actionable insights & business intelligence, administering support for analytics tools and platforms, optimizing fleet performance, and guiding data-driven decisions.
 


   Core Responsibilities
 



     Support cross-functional administrative & operational needs for digital data & analytics platform
   


     Collaborate closely with operations engineering, asset management, and site technician teams
   


     Curate metrics, KPI’s, and reports that transform equipment information into operational intelligence
   


     Manage recurring reporting processes and identify actionable items
   


     Perform ad-hoc analyses to quantify energy and revenue impact from operational events
   


     Design and maintain dashboards to drive actionable insights
   


     Support regulatory reporting requirements such as NERC GADS
   



   Required Skills
 



     Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, engineering preferred

Company: access 2 insight
 Location: Chicago, IL
 Type: Full Time

 ABOUT US:
 access2insight (a2i) develops and implements data-driven strategies that enable marketers to make better decisions and build stronger direct relationships with consumers. Our team has unique experience applying rigorous analytic approaches in less “data-rich” environments (ex: Consumer Packaged Goods) and for clients in the early stages of understanding and leveraging their data. We address a variety of client needs, focusing primarily on i) end-to-end CRM solutions; ii) data-driven strategies; and iii) sales + marketing integration.
 In late 2012 we founded a2i, leaving a larger organization to start one that embodied our vision of how to treat clients and employees while building an enduring, high-growth business. We have quickly built a roster of industry-leading clients within CPG, Retail, Healthcare, and Hospitality and continue to grow at a fast pace.
 WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
 We’re adding to our team and seek bright, analytical, driven individuals to our Chicago team. We need versatile team members eager to take on different roles as we grow, with responsibilities across our practice areas.

 Data-Driven Strategy

 Analyze client data (primarily in SAS) and develop strategies to address client business needs
 Develop and automate reporting to assess marketing campaign performance
 Partner with our modeling / execution specialists to ensure strategies are properly implemented
 Identify opportunities to improve efficiency, and lead associated implementation efforts

 Predictive Modeling / Segmentation

 Help identify opportunities for predictive modeling to enhance strategies
 Assist throughout the model-building process (ex: data preparation, model validation/scoring)

 Marketing Operations and Execution

 Manage vendors and partners, ensuring data quality and adherence to appropriate processes
 Utilize campaign management and other tools (ex: Unica) to build out and execute marketing strategies


 WHAT YOUR BACKGROUND MIGHT LOOK LIKE:

 Bachelor’s or Master’s with focus on analytic / quantitative skills
 Experience or interest in learning:

 Programming (SAS, SQL, Visual Basic)
 Campaign management tools
 Leveraging data to improve business result


 Please submit resumes and cover letters to Jobs@access2insight.com

Strong Business Analysis experience.
Experience in Airline Domain (Call/Contact Center experience a plus)
Experience as Business Analysis, Data Analysis and working experience in IT transformation Programs.
Reimagine Business Processes with focus on leveraging digital technologies and industry best practices
Expertise in Requirements Gathering, Analysis, Rationalization & Management. Solution design (target state), Project Planning & Documentation (Process Recommendations, templates & tools, Business Requirements and Functional Specification Document, Customer Journey mapping)
Ability to analyze and share recommendations to improve/modify existing processes / systems for clients
Understanding of data and application architectures

Knowledge of AWS and/or ServiceNow a plus.

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Monday to Friday

Surgical Directions is a leading perioperative and anesthesia consulting firm that has partnered with over 400 healthcare clients to drive efficiencies and profitable growth. As a rapidly growing organization, we seek to be the leader in healthcare transformation solutions that radically improve client performance and patient lives. We instill realistic and lasting change via our peer-to-peer collaboration, clinical and analytics expertise and proven methodologies.
 Surgical Directions is looking for a motivated and driven Business Analyst. The Business Analyst is responsible for creating, analyzing, and communicating data, insights and comparative benchmarks of hospital performance to assist the Company and its consultants with the discovery of current state client operational, financial and clinical performance and to assist in identification of potential improvement areas. This is a client-facing consulting role.
 Responsibilities

 Ensures all data elements are collected from the client in a timely and efficient manner
 Analyzes, organizes, and formats relevant data and prepares findings in a comprehensive summary report to Business Consultants and other team members as assigned. Material should be complete and organized with common methodology, consistent formatting, up-to-date templates, and sourced accordingly
 Designs documents and analytical tools that assist Business Consultants, team members, and clients with reports to easily comprehend the data, such as dashboards, statistics, graphs, images and lists, etc.
 Provides suggestive content to consistently improve deliverable work and provide Business Consultants with alternative approaches, as needed
 Assists Business Consultants in coordinating conference calls, travel logistics, and on-site project activity, as needed
 Responds to Business Consultant’s client requests in a timely and efficient manner via phone conference, email, and/or occasionally on site at a client location
 Standardizes deliverables, builds internal consensus and rolls out new methodologies, templates, and/or other deliverables under the direction of Company’s leadership team
 Provides document and communication support including but not limited to letters, proposals, presentations, research on healthcare topics, manual updates, reports, faxes, and e-mails
 Participates in Company’s seminars and tradeshows and other business development activities as directed
 Assists other in-office staff members as needed and approved by Supervisor
 May be required to complete work assignments and provide occasional client onsite support before and/or after normal business hours dependent on client deadlines and other staff commitments
 Functions as the primary source of contact with clients for data-related needs
 Be flexible and able to function in different work environments
 Must have ability to travel up to 80% (M-Th)
 Perform other duties as assigned or requested

 Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in a healthcare-related field preferred
 Superior written and oral communication skills
 Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
 Work as a member of a team as well as a self-motivator with ability to work independently
 Strong people skills and ability to engage all levels of the organization (especially frontline)
 Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills required
 Must be willing to travel up to 80% (based on client demand)
 Proof of COVID vaccination will be required due to duties of role

 Surgical Directions is an equal opportunity employer
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, or sex.

McDermott Will & Emery is a leading global law firm helping to propel the success of today’s most respected, dynamic, and important organizations. More than 1,200 lawyers strong, we bring our personal passion and legal prowess to bear in every matter for our clients and the people they serve. Pride and determination abound here because every member of our team is respected, supported, and inspired to exceed. We have been recognized as a top firm to work by The American Lawyer, Working Mother Magazine, Vault, and the Human Rights Campaign for both lawyers and business professionals.
 As part of our ongoing commitment to be #AlwaysBetter for our people, clients, and communities, we have created a culture of belonging that champions your individuality and authenticity as both a person and a professional. From our competitive compensation, top benefits and award-winning professional development programs to industry-leading wellness initiatives, we support you through every stage of your life and career so you can live a life you love both in and outside of the office.
 The Information Governance Data Analyst helps support the development and execution of an Information Governance (IG) framework that enables the ability to actively govern client data and build consensus on how it should be stored and organized. This position will design and maintain data dashboards that provide greater insight into the success of various Information Governance Programs. The Information Governance Data Analyst works under general supervision and relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
 As an Information Governance Data Analyst you will:

Collaborate with Information Technology, Information Security and General Counsel personnel to drive awareness, compliance, and change management when it comes to storing and managing Firm information
Develop outreach and training plans for all practice groups on how to properly store and maintain Firm data
Deliver training to all Firm practice groups from both Legal and Business Operations
Collaborate with the client intake team regarding new clients, matters and lateral attorneys to analyze and understand business requirements and translate them into optimal data visualizations
Design statistical methods to perform quality control and to ensure client data accuracy
Utilize data visualization tools to report on the results of on-going operations and IG projects
Identify and implement process improvements within the information governance framework that adapt to the changing needs of end-users

Job Requirements:

 

Bachelor’s degree
At least three (3) years of related work experience
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word)
Experience with PowerBI; ServiceNow
Strong technology and analytical skills
Strong understanding of relational databases and data integration tools
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and prioritize responsibilities
Ability to handle and maintain confidential information
Ability to work independently and under own direction and initiative

Position Goals:
 Analyze data from multiple and/or disparate sources to produce and present information that is critical to the successful performance and management of the Consumer Line of Business (LOB). Develop dashboards and key data points that provide strategic and actionable insights into the business. Enhance operational efficiencies through automation of processes and reporting. Provide data driven recommendations to improve business performance and decision making.
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Create business reports that provide insight into key data points.



Develop and deploy dashboards.


Deliver ad hoc reports.



Analyze and collect data for various types of business reports, accurately and efficiently.



Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases.


Present information using data visualization techniques.


Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges.


Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends.


Deliver insights on potential areas of growth, optimization, and improvements.



Lead and/or assist with analysis as it relates to the tools and models utilized within the Consumer LOB (staffing model, network planning, variable compensation, goal setting tools, etc.).


Work cross-departmentally on data-driven strategies that improve business processes and decision-making.


Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers.


Support various Consumer LOB departments, in reaching their goals through analysis.


Translate stakeholder’s requirements into reporting deliverables.


Lead and/or participate on special projects as needed, including but not limited to upgrades, patches, consolidations, and integrations.


Position Requirements:
 Education - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems (MIS), business, or a related field OR Associate degree/two (2) years of college plus two (2) years of related work/military experience OR four (4) years of related work/military experience (plus additional required experience list below).
 Experience - A minimum of five (5) years of business intelligence, business analyst or related experience, including two years of report writing experience using SQL or similar technology.
 Other - None.
 Preferred Requirements:
 Experience in banking or the financial services industry
 Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite, including Microsoft Visio
 Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task between several projects.

 Experience Required
 
 A minimum of five (5) years of business intelligence, business analyst or related experience, including two years of report writing experience using SQL or similar technology. 

Education Required
 
 Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field

At Beyond Finance, we've made it our mission to help everyday Americans escape the endless cycle of crippling debt and step into a brighter financial future. Through compassionate, individualized care, supportive user-centric technology, and customized financial solutions, we've helped over 300,000 clients on their path to a debt-free life.
 While we're proud of what we've already accomplished (over $2 billion in resolved debt), we're searching for new collaborators to help us get to the next level! If you're looking to join a forward-thinking, rapidly growing organization with helping people as its number one goal, we want to hear from you.

 About the Role
 The FP&A Analyst will be responsible for performing analysis and using SQL to source data, develop and update financial documents, and report KPI metrics. The ideal candidate will have a strategic mindset and will quickly build a holistic understanding of the business. In this role there is a specific focus on Business Analyst related skills such as SQL, dataset manipulation, effective use of Excel / pivot tables, and performance reporting. As time allows, they may assist in other team initiatives and projects spanning data management, external party reporting, and financial modeling.
 What You'll Do

Performance reporting to managers and executives
Conduct insightful analyses on major trends, challenges and opportunities and create clear and effective visualizations
Develop a thorough understanding of every aspect of running the business
Consider end-to-end processes dependencies and advise on the effects of changes
Resolve issues and push through obstacles by being resourceful and self-directed
Actively participate in and influence discussions around reporting requirements, data needs, and financial models
Consistently deliver high-quality data for members within the team
Follow, maintain and improve all documentation for projects, analyses and reports
Provide subject matter expertise for multiple projects concurrently through all phases of the development lifecycle
Exercise flexibility in handling multiple tasks in this fast-paced FinTech/Start-up environment

What We Look For

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Engineering or other fields that focus on critical problem solving through quantitative methods
0 - 2 years of work experience in an analytical organization; 1+ years of experience working with joining data together, interrogating and vetting the data
Sound understanding of best practices and methodologies; experience with relational structures, structured query language (SQL), data warehouse, and reporting techniques
Experience as a financial/business analyst, in a dynamic business environment, with demonstrated reporting, analytical, and database experience
Self-motivated and managed, exceptional follow-through
Solid problem-solving skills and a strong analytical thought process
Excellent oral and written communication skills and superior customer service record
Proven track record in taking ownership to deliver results within a fast-paced environment
High standards of accuracy and precision; strong attention to detail; highly organized.


 Why Join Us?
 While you make a difference for others, we'll work to make a difference for you, providing an uplifting, collaborative work environment and benefits that reflect your value to us. For eligible full-time employees, we offer:

Considerable employer contributions for health, dental, and vision programs
Generous PTO, paid holidays, and paid parental leave
401(k) matching program
Merit advancement opportunities
Career development & training

And finally, our team spirit and culture! We cultivate an environment of community, connection, and belonging across our entire organization.
 Beyond Finance does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job positions. No fee will be paid to their parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to Beyond Finance employees or the Beyond Finance HR team. No placement fee will be paid to any third party unless such a request has been made by the Beyond HR team.

WHO ARE WE?
 Launch Potato is a digital media company with a portfolio of brands and technologies. As The Discovery and Conversion Company, Launch Potato's mission is to be the most innovative, tech-enabled media company connecting consumers to the world's leading brands.
 The company is headquartered in vibrant downtown Delray Beach, Florida, with a unique international team across over a dozen countries. Launch Potato's success comes from a diverse, energetic culture and a high-performing, entrepreneurial team.

 YOUR ROLE
 We are seeking a highly motivated, data-driven professional for our credit cards vertical, responsible for leveraging analytical skills to manage and optimize the daily operations of the business. You will report directly to the VP of Operations & Growth and work closely with cross-functional teams to optimize campaigns and ensure the success of the vertical.
 You will become the subject matter expert in the vertical and you will own reporting standardizations, and ad hoc analysis that will help identify growth opportunities.
 Success in this role will directly impact your ability to earn the team's confidence by delivering insightful, accurate, and actionable data insights through strategic partnerships within the organization.
 SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

Analyze and interpret digital marketing data from various marketing channels, website performance and advertiser conversion and make proactive suggestions for improving ROI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including paid media, content, design, and product, to support the development and implementation of data-driven marketing initiatives while also ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Assist in the development and execution of A/B testing plans to optimize website performance, media buying and other digital marketing initiatives.
Manage marketplace operations, including monitoring full-funnel KPIs, tracking daily and weekly volume trends and updating forecasting models.
Optimize business performance and develop forward-looking projections to drive growth of the Credit Card vertical.
Track advertiser performance including products analysis, cross-category comparisons and monitoring of partner key success metrics.
Assist in compiling business proposals and partner facing materials by pulling and analyzing relevant data sets.
Build reports and dashboards to support compliance, account management and marketing teams.
Conduct regular competitive analysis to identify industry trends and opportunities.
Effectively communicate updates and changes to the team.
Contribute to ad-hoc analytical projects.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing analyst role, preferably within the financial services industry.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience working with complex data sets.
Track record of effectively collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Experience in a similar role involving business analytics and operations management.
Expertise in Excel and/or Google Sheets, including pivot tables and advanced formulas.

NICE TO HAVES

Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, and/or other reporting and analytics tools, including building reports and dashboards.
Experience with SQL, SSAS or other database/analysis packages.
Experience and understanding of performance marketing and lead generation.
Experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.


 Want to make your impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!
 Since day one, we've been committed to having a diverse, inclusive team and culture. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion.
 We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

job_title: Data Visualization Specialist (Tableau and Sigma) – R01526495
job_description:
Data Visualization Specialist (Tableau and Sigma) - R01526495


About Brillio: 


  Brillio is the partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies seeking to turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Backed by Bain Capital, Brillio is one of the fastest growing digital technology service providers. We help clients harness the transformative potential of the four superpowers of technology - cloud computing, internet of things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), and mobility. Born digital in 2014, we apply Customer Experience Solutions, Data Analytics and AI, Digital Infrastructure and Security, and Platform and Product Engineering expertise to help clients quickly innovate for growth, create digital products, build service platforms, and drive smarter, data-driven performance. With delivery locations across United States, Romania, Canada, Mexico, and India, our growing global workforce of over 6,000 Brillians blends the latest technology and design thinking with digital fluency to solve complex business problems and drive competitive differentiation for our clients. Brillio was awarded ‘Great Place to Work’ in 2021 and 2022
 


 Data Visualization Specialist (Tableau and Sigma)

 Primary Skills

 Advanced Excel, Alteryx, SQL, Tableau, Tableau Prep 

Specialization

 Tableau Development: Senior Lead BI Engineer 

Job requirements

 Job Title: Data Visualization Specialist (Tableau and Sigma) Responsibilities: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and understand data visualization needs. Develop and design interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau and Sigma. Create visually appealing and user-friendly charts, graphs, and infographics that effectively communicate complex data. Clean, transform, and analyze data to ensure accuracy and usability for visualization purposes. Conduct data exploration and identify patterns, trends, and outliers to uncover actionable insights. Optimize performance and efficiency of existing visualizations and dashboards. Provide guidance and best practices on data visualization design and storytelling. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, techniques, and advancements in data visualization tools and techniques. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and provide timely support for their visualization requirements. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Proven experience as a Data Visualization Specialist or similar role. Proficiency in Tableau and Sigma. Strong understanding of data visualization principles and best practices. Proficient in data manipulation, analysis, and transformation. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets. Ability to translate complex data into clear and concise visualizations. Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders. Strong in SQL and other data querying languages is preferred. Experience with other data visualization tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus. Knowledge of statistical concepts and techniques is a plus. 




  Know what it’s like to work and grow at Brillio: Click here

Sr Data Governance – Data Operations –2VP
 Responsible for improving data quality across the organization by implementing and maintaining an institutional data governance structure and data quality methodology.
 Establishes policies, standards and processes that will be developed and maintained to support the data governance function. As subject area expert, consults on data quality improvements across the organization. Advocate for the adoption of rigorous data quality management.
 Duties Include:
 1. Develop tools and processes used to maintain a common, data standard across the organization.
 2. Assess, manage, maintain strategies that reduce data redundancy and increases the consistency / confidence of data used for decision making; improving knowledge firm-wide.
 3. Define and deliver data management standards, processes and controls and content for the creation and maintenance of common data dictionaries.
 4. Participates in periodic reviews to ensure continued compliance with the data governance policies (includes compliance assessments, monitoring and control testing). 5. Resolves conflicting priorities among data owners, data consumers and custodians within sphere of the domain.
 6. Collaborates with partners across the organization in maintaining the data governance and data quality structures ensuring we are meeting business needs while balancing quality, risk and cost.
 7. Carries out activities that are large in scope, cross-functional and technically difficult. 8. Role is balanced between high level operational execution and development, and execution of strategic direction of business function activities.
 9. Conducts preliminary analysis.
 10. Responsible for direct interaction with different committees and/or management.
 11. Strategic in developing, implementing and administering programs within functional areas.
 12. Able to communicate with IT and business partners at various levels and adjusting communication style accordingly.
 Qualifications

A College or University degree and/or relevant proven work experience is required / preferred.


Related Industry qualification is required / preferred


Knowledge of Data Governance, Data Quality, and Enterprise Data Management concepts.


Proficient in SQL skill. It is required to do data analysis, write complex queries, and compare results.


Familiar with root cause analysis methods: Five Whys, Pareto Principle and Fishbone diagram.


Familiar with Business Intelligence Tools, For example Power BI or Tableau.


Problem Solving skills – Ability to analyze the data, identify the problem and recommendations for the resolution.


Understand and be capable of effectively communicating the role of Data Governance to both business and technical communities within the sphere of the data domain.


Excellent oral and written communication skills are required.


In-depth Functional / Industry Knowledge is required


Highly flexible and adaptable to change.


Technical skills / systems knowledge is required
