job_title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing & Enrollment - Hybrid
job_description:
Company Description
  Adtalem  At Adtalem Global Education, we seek to empower students and members to achieve their goals, find success and make inspiring contributions to our global community. Adtalem is a leading healthcare educator that partners with organizations to proactively address future workforce needs and empowers career development with access to world-class academic curriculums, certifications and training programs across the medical and healthcare industries.  Adtalem institutions and companies include: American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Chamberlain University, Ross University School of Medicine, Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine, and Walden University. (NYSE: ATGE; member S&P MidCap 400 Index) For more information, please visit adtalem.com.



 Job Description
  Opportunity at a Glance Adtalem Global Education (NYSE: ATGE) is a global provider of educational services rich with opportunities for growth and offering competitive wages and benefits. As part of our Digital Center of Excellence, the Senior Data Analyst, Enrollment, will partner with senior marketing and enrollment leaders to measure performance of enrollment people, process, and technology. This will require identification, validation, and measurement of enrollment KPI’s, which are brought to life through development of self-service reporting tools, trustworthy data, visualization, and presentation of insights.  Responsibilities

 Hybrid Opportunity - if located within 50 miles of an Adtalem office, our new Senior Data Analyst, Marketing & Enrollment will be on-site 3 days a week.
 Develops dashboards, visualizations, and insights that inform stakeholders across the business.
 Partners with marketing and enrollment leadership to develop success criteria that aligns to organizational objectives.
 Evaluates KPI’s to ensure they are aligning with the high-level objectives. Recommends new and improved measurements that evolve with the business and validates causation to business success.
 Partners with business intelligence team to ensure data governance. Develops stakeholder trust in data accuracy and cleanliness
 Presents insights to senior leaders. Organizes objective data stories that can be consumed by various audiences; from senior executives to frontline managers
 Synergizes insights methodologies across business units. Strives for consistency while meeting customized needs of business partners
 Develop automated solutions to reduce ad-hoc data needs. Support ad-hoc requests when data is not available
 Develop queries in Big Query to build reports and provide ad-hoc analysis/data pulls as needed
 Validate data and troubleshoot reporting issues
 Bring an objective, data-driven opinion to strategic discussions. Serve as a stakeholder invested in accomplishing targets.
 Measure business objectives in consumable dynamic formats
 Maintains strong understanding of business challenges and opportunities so works meets the context of what is requested

 #LI-MD1
 #LI-HYBRID



 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, Finance, Computer Sciences, Math or related field.
 3-5 years of experience working with databases, reporting on data and working in an analytical capacity is required. Marketing and sales analytics experience preferred.
 Hands-on data visualization experience required; preferably in Power BI and/or Tableau.
 SQL and/or Big Query coding experience and experience accessing data from complex data lakes required
 Python experience preferred.
 Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office, Internet and web applications
 Excellent verbal/written communication skills and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Strong prioritization and organizational skills. Ability to negotiate priorities in a matrixed organization.

 Additional Information
  In support of the pay transparency laws enacted across the country, the expected salary range for this position is between $51,962 and $93,918. Actual pay will be adjusted based on job-related factors permitted by law, such as experience and training; geographic location; licensure and certifications; market factors; departmental budgets; and responsibility. Our Talent Acquisition Team will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements. The position qualifies for the below benefits.   Adtalem offers a robust suite of benefits including:

 Health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
 401k Retirement Program + 6% employer match
 Participation in Adtalem’s Flexible Time Off (FTO) Policy
 12 Paid Holidays   For more information related to our benefits please visit: https://careers.adtalem.com/us/en/benefits.


 
We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. At Adtalem, we welcome everyone and have a strong commitment towards diversity and inclusion. We encourage our Colleagues to be their true authentic selves and support laws that prohibit discrimination everywhere we do business. We also maintain a drug-free workplace.

Overview:
 

 We are seeking a Senior Data and Marketing Analyst to lead Tricoci’s data driven consumer acquisition and retention efforts and activities. The role will oversee all aspects of data strategy, data science, Business Intelligence, customer insights, campaign analytics, platform strategy, and customer and performance optimization. Outputs include data acquisition and reporting processes, KPI reporting enhancements and consumer targeting initiatives and strategies. While a function of Technology group, this role will work cross functionally with Marketing, Operations, and Finance to ensure data consistency and usability. Metrics will be prepared and communicated with a high-level focus and attention towards impacting the overall operation and sales channels, while executing the vision of a data driven product and services company.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Developing analytics and data strategy, policies, processes, and toolsets that will enable automated reporting, insights generation and the full realization of data as a strategic asset in order to drive business value, insights, and growth.
 Creating strategic growth drivers leveraging consumer data. 
Innovate business intelligence system capabilities, processes, databases and dashboards.
 Streamline data systems and data structures needed to enhance data-driven value creation via automated dashboards, advanced capabilities like data sciences and predictive analytics, and play a leading role in the formulation of internal insights integration, development, communications and execution of the Company’s data strategy.
 Improve consumer spend, acquisition and retention targeting through use of organic and external data sets. 
Develops, implements, and disseminates metrics/KPIs, profitability and outcomes including dashboards and data visualization toolsets from all facets of our business including service, retail, eCommerce and distribution.
 Oversee execution of data and analytics roadmap, including establishing projects for delivery.
 Create data driven presentations to support strategy.
 Perform ad-hoc analysis and reporting as required.
 Other duties as assigned.
 Qualifications: 
 
Proven ability to analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns that drive proposed strategies to that increase account liquidation, revenue, and efficiencies.
 Experience understanding service, retail, and eCommerce guest behavior – guest retention and churn, cohort analysis, and statistical quartiles. 
5+ years of experience within the data analysis field including KPI creation, reporting, data use processes.
 Ability to analyze and report on customer acquisition cost CAC, LTV:CAC, ROAS, etc.
 Proven analytic and quantitative decision-making skills, including significant examples of problem-solving, performing detailed analysis, and developing and communicating recommendations.
 Strong work-ethic, with high degree of self-motivation and ability to work with limited supervision.
 Ability to manage demanding deadlines, changing requirements, and working with various resources or information.
 Ability to manage datasets.
 Excellent level of proficiency with Microsoft Power BI
 Excellent level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Access.
 Preferred proficiency with SQL
 Excited by a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment—able to tackle multiple priorities under tight timelines with the flexibility to pivot when necessary.
 Excellent interpersonal skills; excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Bachelor’s degree.
 Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines.
 Ability to build strong partnerships across the stakeholders within the organization.

Overview: 
 
   Topco Associates is currently seeking an HRIS Operations Data Analyst to join our Human Resources Team in Elk Grove Village, IL. This position will be a hybrid role, with the successful candidate conducting work in our Elk Grove Village office three times per week and virtually twice per week.
 


 Topco's mission is to provide solutions for our member owners, regional retailers and wholesalers, and help them achieve a competitive advantage in the markets they serve. We aspire to develop high-performing teams to resemble the diversity of our members' shopper communities to drive greater innovation and creativity that ultimately enhances our business results and the value Topco provides to its membership.
 


 We have an exciting and challenging new opportunity for a HRIS Operations Data Analyst to join our HR team. This role is a hands-on role where the right candidate will enjoy working in a variety of areas within our HR department. Further the right candidate can build deep technical skills while effectively administering our HRIS system and other various partner platforms (e.g., UKG/UltiPro, engagement survey partner). Additionally, the right candidate enjoys being a reporting guru. For example, this individual will have the ability to analyze relational information queried from our HR platforms and create reports that support HR and other internal stakeholders. In addition, this role will participate in projects as a member or lead depending on the scope and deliverable.
  Responsibilities: 
 
 System Support


 Serve as the UKG/UltiPro system expert and primary point-of-contact for day-to-day support of business processes, integrations, reporting, and dashboards to ensure consistent, high-quality business operations
 Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements for process improvements, and once prioritized, configure, test, and deploy those solutions
 Assist in the review, testing and implementation (if necessary) of system (e.g., UltiPro) upgrades, including researching functionality, identifying areas of impact, conducting testing, and educating the Human Resources and Payroll teams on enhancements
 Serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g., HRIS partner integrations); provide support HR systems integrations
 Maintain awareness of current trends in HRIS tools with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Participate in user group meetings/conferences, as necessary


 Compliance and Reporting


 Ensures 100% compliance with internal and external audits and other federal or state reporting requirements (401K audit). Provide data for and file all Department of Labor and EEOC required filings required for compliance
 Develop end to end reporting and analytics to enable HR Business Partners and Business Leaders to examine and identify trends, provide insights and empower decision making (building dashboards, configurations, delivery and maintenance of reports that highlight turnover, headcount, open positions, etc.) 
Present relevant trends and insights in clear, succinct reports to key stakeholders and demonstrate the implications for the business
 Serve as a reporting subject matter expert for the HR team by documenting processes, conducting knowledge share sessions, and providing oversight to the reporting landscape
 Provide supplementary support for day-to-day HR reporting needs from the business.
 Keep up-to-date of industry trends and new methods in people analytics, data visualization, and HR information systems as well as business processes


 Data Management


 Processes all new hires, terminations, transfers, and record changes
 Ensure data integrity is maintained throughout the systems by running queries and analyzing data
 Maintain user security and systems access for the organization including implementing new security groups and roles to enable functionality such as employee self-service


 HR Processes and Benefits


 Review and enhance HR processes such as recruiting, onboarding, compensation, performance management, using appropriate technology
 Serve as the main point of contact for and respond to Verification of Employment and Unemployment Claims


 Payroll


 Responsible for the review and set-up for all garnishment orders including preparation of responses to orders and correspondence as well as maintain garnishment rules in the payroll system including research to determine proper withholding from employee wages in compliance with state and federal regulations and garnishment type
 Answer and resolve payroll questions while providing accurate information in a timely and concise manner to all stakeholders
 Provide support for the annual bonus payments and all other lump sum payments
 Process semi-monthly payroll, W-2, and year-end processes (in partnership with our Finance team)
 Corrects time exceptions in the time management system
 Process and approve time, following up as necessary 
Research and resolve all payroll issues
 Support and ensure accurate pre-payroll set-up (data)


   Performs other duties as assigned
  Qualifications: 
 
 Education:


 Bachelor's degree in HR, computer science or related field or equivalent work experience


 Previous Experience:


 2+ years of HRIS (UKG/UltiPro preferred), HR generalist or specialist experience
 HR Specialist background in HR Shared Services, Benefits Administration, and/or Payroll



 Other qualifications:


 Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of associates and vendors/partners
 Advanced skills in Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
 Ability to handle highly confidential information with discretion
 Able to pull together HR datasets and analytics, using standard tools
 Ability to be flexible and adapt to change
 Quantitative analytical abilities 
High attention to detail
 Understanding of HR infrastructure. Basic understanding of most HR sub-functions, and their inter-dependencies
 Exhibits a sense of urgency in all deliverables
 Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and handle various projects simultaneously
 Independent/critical thinker to identify creative solutions


   Topco strives for a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace that reflects our member shopper’s communities. If your experience similarly reflects what you see listed in the job description, please consider applying, as individuals come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
 


 Topco is an equal employment opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis, including age, sex, color, race, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, political belief, veteran's status, or disability that does not prohibit performance of essential job functions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - National Programs, Policy and Risk (NPPR), Supervision & Regulation
job_description:
Company
  Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago
  The Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago’s Wholesale Credit Risk Center (WCRC) uses data, analytics, and models to inform banking supervision. Whether creating analytical tools used for the ongoing monitoring of credit markets or modeling wholesale credit to identify emerging risks, the WCRC applies analysis in innovative ways to help supervise the financial system. As such, the WCRC is looking for an enthusiastic, technically skilled individual who can provide leadership in data management as well as subject matter expertise around available wholesale credit data, including third-party vendors.
 
 Department Overview:
 
 The WCRC, housed within the Supervision and Regulation department, plays a critical role in the Federal Reserve System’s core mission of maintaining a healthy financial system. The Federal Reserve is mandated to foster the stability, integrity, and efficiency of the nation's monetary, financial and payment systems to promote optimal economic performance. This includes a macro-prudential approach to banking supervision. To this end, the WCRC collects and analyzes both bank and industry wholesale credit risk data, provides a horizontal perspective of wholesale credit risk management practices, and supports supervision of capital adequacy and stress testing for wholesale credit exposures. Staff of the WCRC form the core of Federal Reserve System teams that develop loss models for wholesale lending and assess such modeling efforts at systemically important financial institutions. The WCRC also partners with the Federal Reserve Board of Governors to execute SNC examinations.
 

   Your Responsibilities:
 



     Partner with IT and third-party data vendors to design database tables and ETL workflows for end users.
   


     Utilize data mining to extract information from multiple data sets, provide intermediate to complex data analysis and monitor data quality
   


     Develop and implement project plans, timelines, and milestones for moderate to highly complex projects
   


     Consult or serve as a technical expert in assigned area(s) to brainstorm data solutions utilizing domain knowledge for stakeholders
   


     Support and coordinate efforts around controls to ensure data integrity and adherence with requirements and guidelines
   


     Assist in translating business need to design and develop tools, metrics and dashboards for insight and data visualization
   


     Prepare and present both orally and in written form, findings and assessments concerning complex matters or institutions to internal and external stakeholders
   


     Build and maintain strategic work relationships and networks with both internal and external stakeholders, such as other Reserve Banks and the Board of Governors
   


     Serve as a mentor and/or coach; provide technical expertise and constructive feedback; train and help develop staff members
   



   Your Background:
 



     Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
   


     Five or more years of direct work-related experience Knowledge of and experience with databases, programming, and scripting language(s) such as SQL, R, Python, and/or SAS. Experience with cloud-based data systems is a plus. Familiarity with ETL Tools and building data pipelines Ability to understand and execute business processes; ability to apply complex concepts and interdependencies in completing tasks
   


     Demonstrates analytical and problem-solving skills
   


     Demonstrates critical thinking and decision-making abilities along with strong written and oral communication
   


     Demonstrates the ability to provide effective direction or consultation Possesses the ability to coach/guide and provide constructive feedback Possesses strong teamwork skills and the ability to build and work collaboratively within and across work teams Demonstrates the ability to manage time and projects effectively by adjusting quickly to new and different priorities Demonstrates aptitude to leverage relevant technology and software applications Possesses general business acumen
   



   Location:
 

   This position is remote work mode eligible. The hybrid flex work mode is also available if it is a preference to the selected candidate.
 


   What We Offer:
 

   Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, 401k savings plan, retirement plan, paid time off and transit benefit . A continuous learning environment with opportunities to gain new skills and grow your career Onsite gym and subsidized cafeteria
 


   Other Requirements:
 



     Ability and willingness to travel up to 5%
   


     As a condition of employment, Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago employees must comply with the Bank’s ethics rules which generally prohibit employees, their spouses/domestic partners, and minor children from owning securities, such as stock, of banks or savings associations or their affiliates, such as bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies. If you or your spouse/domestic partner or minor child own such securities and would not be willing or able to divest them if you accepted an offer of Bank employment, you should raise this issue with the recruiter for this posting, who can provide you contact information for our ethics official if necessary
   


     This position requires access to confidential supervisory information and/or FOMC information, which is limited to "Protected Individuals" as defined in the U.S. federal immigration law. Protected Individuals include, but are not limited to, U.S. citizens, U.S. nationals, and U.S. permanent residents who either are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization or who have applied for naturalization within the requisite timeframe. Candidates who are not U.S. citizens or U.S. permanent residents may be eligible for the information access required for this position and sponsorship for a work visa, and subsequently for permanent residence, if they sign a declaration of intent to become a U.S. citizen and meet other eligibility requirements. In addition, all candidates must undergo applicable background checks and comply with all applicable information handling rules, and all non-U.S. citizens must sign a declaration of intent to become a U.S. citizen and pursue a path to citizenship.
   



 We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.



   Full Time / Part Time
  Full time
 

   Regular / Temporary
  Regular
 

   Job Exempt (Yes / No)
  Yes
 

   Job Category
 


   Work Shift
  First (United States of America)
 

 The Federal Reserve Banks believe that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.

We are seeking a motivated and experienced Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in understanding and optimizing our business operations processes. You will collaborate closely with business experts to create and maintain comprehensive documentation of our business processes, including detailed illustrations of technology and data flows over time. 


Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our business operations processes.
Collaborate with business experts to create and maintain detailed business process documentation, including technology and data flows.
Conduct front-end testing of products developed by the data team, leveraging test plans and providing detailed feedback for continuous improvements.
Gain and maintain a functional understanding of back-end data to effectively communicate between business and technical teams.
Possess the ability to query and explore databases and metadata to address business questions and perform initial research on data-related inquiries.
Serve as the first point of contact and support for customer inquiries, conducting thorough research with the team and providing timely resolutions (tier 1 support function).
Collect issue documentation and perform verification before creating incidents and assigning them to the appropriate team.

 Position Overview:
 Showpad is seeking an experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join the Marketing Operations team.  Key Responsibilities:

Identify and document data sources and rules required to populate and maintain the data model, ensuring marketing data hygiene and consistent data flow between systems
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights into campaign performance, marketing ROI, pacing towards pipeline/bookings goals, data integrity, and other KPIs

 The Advanced Data Analyst is responsible for working with both structured and unstructured data sets to provide business insights and recommendations to improve the quality of the Wintrust data leveraging industry standard analytical approaches and technologies.  What You’ll Do

 Gather, structure, and analyze data from multiple complex data sources into actionable business insights using industry standard analytical tools and technologies.

 Translate business requirements into technical documentation needed for ETL development.

 Actimize AML ETL Production Support as needed.

 Identifies hidden use cases from complex unstructured datasets and come up with useful insights.
 Influences key decisions through data analysis and offers recommendations to senior leadership teams.
 Support/enhance/create ETL packages to address AML ETL business requirements, ensuring all related ETL processes meets best-in-class standards offering high performance.
 Responsible for addressing ETL defects from backlog pool related to Actimize AML data loads.

 Creates enterprise data sets for advanced analytics for BSA AML team members
 Seeks opportunities to deliver continuous process improvement, automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.
 Serves as resource to internal and third party team members on escalated issues and analyzing and designing specifications for less experienced team members.

 Pursue self-development and effective relationships with others by sharing information and knowledge with coworkers and business areas.


 Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years’ experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative field.
 3+ years’ experience in programming and data analysis with a concentration in data analytics, data science, or related field.
 At least 4 years of experience in a Data Analyst role or similar where strong analytical and problem solving skills were required.
 3+ years working experience with statistical applications, such as SQL or SAS
 At least 2 years’ experience working with large data sets and complex databases
 Experience as a Data Analyst, in interpreting, analyzing and reconciling data obtained from variety of sources.
 Experience in preparing Functional Requirement document (FRD) based on business requirements, and data profiling and data analysis.
 Experience with working on Actimize Transaction Monitoring system, AML (Anti-Money Laundering) is a huge plus.
 Proficient in T-SQL development (complex queries, stored procedures and user defined functions) and performance tuning.
 Strong understanding of database and data warehouse concepts and structures.
 Has experience working with Data Warehouse, Data Governance, MDM and BI systems.
 Has experience building ETL pipelines to load data from various sources into DW.
 Strong quantitative skills with a proven ability to translate analysis into meaningful insights.
 Experience in working with Traditional and Distributed ecosystems.
 Proficient in Power BI and MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint including Pivot, Graph and Slicer techniques).

   The Path Forward Return to Work program at Grubhub is a 16-week paid returnship for experienced professionals returning to the workforce after taking time off for caregiving. The program is open to individuals who have at least 5 years of professional experience and have been out of the paid workforce for at least two years to focus on caring for yourself or a loved one. If you meet these criteria, we welcome you to apply.
 


 At Grubhub we are excited to be part of the Path Forward program because we appreciate the skills you can offer, the perspective you provide, and the contributions you will make. This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, update your resume with new experience, and make connections with others transitioning back to the workforce. It also offers support through Path Forward, a nonprofit organization on a mission to empower people who’ve been focused on caregiving transition back to the paid workforce.

 Be curious! Proactively surface insights and trends that improve our customer experience and help us grow faster!
 What You Bring to the Table: 
 
1-2 years of experience in data analytics or a closely related field

 Understanding of data visualization best practices and tools (Excel skills required and Tableau experience preferred)

 Functional experience with one or more of the following: product analytics, loyalty/subscription program analytics, website/app UI/UX optimization, and/or A/B testing is a plus

You have a clear vision of where your career can go. And we have the leadership to help you get there. At CNA, we strive to create a culture in which people know they matter and are part of something important, ensuring the abilities of all employees are used to their fullest potential.
 
 The Catastrophe Risk Management department is seeking an experienced Senior Catastrophe Analyst to join a highly technical and dynamic team that is tasked with driving improvement in the company’s overall management of catastrophe risk. If you are looking for a highly visible role that has a significant impact on the business, this position could be for you. We are searching for candidates that enjoy learning about catastrophes, how they impact CNA, and how the company can price and manage its risk to drive profitability. This role interacts frequently with Underwriting and Claims leadership, as well as other more technical groups. The Catastrophe Risk Management group strives to be best in class by collaborating with senior leadership in developing strategic priorities, building tools and processes to facilitate the execution of those priorities, and reporting on the progress that is being made.
 
 This position reports to the VP of Catastrophe and Exposure Management and will interact frequently with other team members and business units. You will provide sophisticated portfolio analytics that influence various risk management and pricing decisions. Working within the context of an insurance company, you will leverage your diverse set of skills to analyze and manipulate data, build and maintain tools, optimize processes, and communicate findings to property leadership. Motivated, quick learners who possess a natural curiosity and an ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences will excel in this role.
 

   JOB DESCRIPTION:
 


   Essential Duties & Responsibilities
 

 Oversee monthly portfolio roll-up for the entire enterprise and optimize process to improve efficiency.
 Provide analytics to help Business Unit leadership understand their portfolio’s exposure and how it can further improve profitability.
 Assist in the validation of the vendor or in-house built Cat models using claims or other data.
 Provide ability to build and maintain custom tools to help the company better manage catastrophe risk.
 Communicate research and analytics with underwriters, capital modelers, actuaries, and other stakeholders.
 Participate in assessing the impact of real-time catastrophes on CNA’s portfolio.
 Oversee and participate in submitting rating agency questionnaires and responding to various regulatory obligations.
 Independently find innovate solutions to problems.



 May perform additional duties as assigned.



   Reporting Relationship
   VP of Catastrophe and Exposure Management.
 


   Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
 

 Strong proficiency with SQL.
 Knowledge of commercial insurance or reinsurance.
 Solid knowledge of the Verisk or Moody’s RMS Cat model.
 Ability to analyze data and provide valuable insights.
 Proven problem-solving capabilities.
 Proven ability to build statistical risk models or other catastrophe models and tools.
 Programming skills in a language such as VBA, R, or Python, is preferred.
 Strong verbal and written communication skills.
 Ability to effectively interact with all levels of CNA’s internal and external business partners.
 Self-starter with demonstrated ability to generate new ideas and work well with a team.



   Education & Experience
 

 A Bachelor's degree in a technical field, such as computer science, math, actuarial science, analytics, statistics, engineering, physical science, or equivalent.
 Typically a minimum of five years of related work experience.

Department
 
 BSD CRI - Data Warehouse
 
 About the Department
 
 The Center for Research Informatics (CRI) is an organization within the Biological Sciences Division (BSD) that provides informatics resources and services to BSD faculty. Four main services comprise the CRI's operations: applications development, bioinformatics, IT infrastructure and scientific computing, and clinical research data warehousing/business intelligence. Through these service lines, the CRI enables research of the highest scientific merit and advances the state of the art of clinical and translational informatics. The CRI recruits exceptional candidates looking to leverage state-of-the-art technologies to deliver innovative and exciting solutions biomedical researchers.
 
 We are committed to increasing diversity, equity, and inclusion for the benefit of our team members, our institution, our clients, and our community. We will accomplish this by incorporating our values into hiring practices, retention, and culture.
 

 Job Summary
 
 Clinical Research Data Warehouse (CRDW)
 
 Incumbent will be responsible for supporting data requests for the CRDW, as well as for ETL Architecture and Development of our common data model infrastructure. Incumbent will spend 80% of his/her/their time supporting these efforts. This includes understanding and implementing data extractions, transformations, and loads, writing SQL code to incorporate new data sources into data warehouses and affiliated data marts, both local and distributed, and working with existing teams to further development according to existing standards and conventions. There is also a need for data management expertise. This includes data source acquisition and positioning, providing ongoing feedback and support to expand available data sources while improving the team’s understanding of existing data sources, transforming and loading data into data models and platforms, both standardized and unstandardized, and creating and maintaining a growing body of documentation. Incumbent may perform data analysis to answer research questions under the direction of several University faculty members and also support quality improvement initiatives and external reporting. Finally, this position involves translating technical specifications into SQL code, generating data deliverables, and conducting code review. An ideal candidate will be able to quickly master medical terminology related to filling data requests, communicate effectively with a business analyst and clients, write SQL queries which optimize the organization of data deliverables, perform analyses using R and Python, and generate visualizations using Tableau. Prior to delivery of data, the incumbent will assist with data quality checks, making sure that each deliverable matches the original request specifications and that the data is of the highest quality.
 
 Software Development
 
 Incumbent will spend 20% of their time working cross-functionally with the Software Development team optimizing and modernizing custom programs, integrating and migrating data, reporting from various information systems, creating new database schemas, evaluating and implementing open-source software, and giving demonstrations of current projects. Incumbent will be responsible for our installation of REDCap, working closely with the REDCap analyst team, to improve and expand functionality, maintain upgrades, and facilitate 21CFR compliance. The software development team works primarily with C#, ASP.NET, .NET Core, MSSQL Server, MVC, and Web API; however, there is work that may require the use of other programming languages such as Python and Django. 
 

  Responsibilities
 


    Clinical Research Data Warehouse (CRDW) 
  





     Gather and analyze healthcare and other related data to identify and interpret trends in support of data requests, business cases, and proposed projects.
    


      Design, construct, test, and maintain data warehouse and related functionality including extraction and transformation of data using SSIS.
    


      Design, develop, and test business intelligence outputs (including visualization) to ensure useful and insightful information using software including R, Python, Tableau, and/or Excel to support research and quality improvement initiatives.
    


      Test and validate data with the purpose of understanding and making conclusions to support decision-making processes.
    


      Manage a variety of information systems and data files, including large and complex files: analyzing file structure, using and creating file layouts, transforming raw data into finished products.
    


      Monitor for timely and accurate completion of select datasets.
    


      Participate in strategic initiatives to enhance data management and reporting to support research and quality improvement initiatives.
    


      Collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of Data Scientists, Project Managers, and Sr. Developers to ensure high-quality data delivery to faculty. Proactively identify issues and opportunities to improve data systems and related policies as an aspect of data governance. 
    




    Software Development
   





       Design and development – Work as part of the team on existing and new projects, fixing bugs, adding new features.
     


       Cross-functional engagement - Work with other functional partners to contribute to product strategy.
     


       Support - In collaboration with the CRI front line support, professional services, and other members of the team.
     


       Provide technical guidance on resolving customer support issues, as needed.
     



     Other
   




        Investigates, analyzes and resolves day-to-day technical problems using standard procedures.
      


        Works with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for developmental programs. Receives a moderate level of guidance to design applications to meet University and business requirements.
      


        Performs code testing on components and works to ensure that appropriate implementation standards are met. Evaluates design alternatives for development cost and solutions using various methods.
      


        Supports and maintains existing applications. Works with web developers and responds to requests from users.
      


        Performs other related work as needed.
      





 Minimum Qualifications
 

 Education:
  Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.
 
   -
   Work Experience:
  Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline.
 
   -
   Certifications:
 

   -
 


   Preferred Qualifications
 


   Experience:
 



     Understanding of various common data models (OMOP, PCORnet).
   


     Experience with ETL tools.
   


     Experience working with application development and/or agile.
   


     Experience working within regulatory and security requirements for use of electronic personal health information (HIPAA).
   


     Experience with SAML-based authentication.
   


     Experience creating custom software.
   


     Experience with C#, ASP.NET, MSSQL Server, and .NET MVC.
   


     Experience with Web technologies (REST, HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX) and frameworks (React, Angular, Bootstrap, Blazor) and ORM (EF, NHibernate).
   


     Experience in backend database (relational, NoSQL) development and optimization.
   


     Experience with HTTP servers (IIS, Apache).
   


     Experience with a distributed version control system (Subversion, Git).
   


     Knowledge of modern JavaScript tools such as Webpack, Babel, ESLint, Gulp, NPM, Bower, Browserify, Grunt and similar technologies.
   


     Experience with unit and integration testing tools.
   


     Experience in other analytic platforms including R, Stata, Python, SAS.
   


     Experience with business intelligence and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
   


     Expert in SQL and Excel.
   


     Knowledge of healthcare data including ICD-9, ICD-10, and CPT.
   



   Preferred Competencies
 



     High level of problem solving and decision-making skills.
   


     Proficiency in relational databases with experience designing transformations, mappings, and working with reference table.
   


     Ability to translate technical information to non-technical audiences.
   


     Critical thinking and multi-tasking skills with the ability to manage multiple projects.
   


     Time management skills.
   


     Proficiency in creating technical specifications, business cases, and other development-related documentation.
   


     Experience investigating data issues and working with a cross-functional team for problem resolution.
   


     Energized by working through complex problems.
   


     Intellectual curiosity.
   



   Working Conditions
 



     Office, Hybrid.
   



   Application Documents
 



     Resume (required)
   


     Cover Letter (preferred)

JOB DESCRIPTION
 This position is for an Information Risk Analyst on a restricted application team, and the candidate will work under the direction of the Application Development Manager. The position will be responsible for working with Application Development, Infrastructure, Technology Controls Officers, Production Support and Operations teams, as well as JPMC enterprise and external client Risk Management teams, to ensure application compliance with both JPMC and client IT Risk policies and controls. The position will involve coordination and support of various annual audits conducted internally by JPMC, independent third party auditors and by external clients, and will also work with independent third party teams to coordinate execution of security tests, to document vulnerabilities and to follow up with coordination of remediation with appropriate groups.

A Government Security Clearance is required for this position. This includes, but is not limited to: 
   
Fingerprinting
Credit Check and Tax Filing History
Employment History and References
Proof of either United States Citizenship or legal U.S. Legal Permanent Residence for 3 years

5-7 years of experience in Information Technology
3 years of experience in IT Risk Management, IT Audit/ IT Governance/IT Controls or equivalent
Knowledge/experience with NIST 800-53 controls (or an equivalent control framework)
Experience with SSAE18 SOC1 audit
Proficient working knowledge within the following risk domains/technologies is preferred: 
   
Database and application security
System/Access Administration
Firewall technologies
Network Architecture
Security Event Logging & Monitoring
Database/Application/Network Layer Secure Protocols
Physical and Environmental Security
Secure Software/Code Development
Change Management
Vulnerability Management

Proficient verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively lead discussions and meetings
Proficient risk assessment, interpretation, analytical and negotiation skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
Experience in an Agile Delivery Framework

job_title: Senior Analyst- N.A. Business Intelligence & Insights
job_description:
General information 




All posting locations: Chicago, Illinois, United States of America 
Job Function: 03 - Finance 
Date Published: 16-Jun-2023 
Ref #: R-71190 








Description & Requirements 



Position Summary 
As part of the central Business Intelligence & Insights team- within the Central Finance Organization- the Sr. BI Analyst will work on the end-to-end development of high-impact BI projects for the North America Zone. You’ll be part of high-performing agile team working at the intersection of Data- Business- & Design – engaging with many different parts of the business and leveraging a modern tech stack. We are looking for a self-starter who will work alongside BI Managers- data engineers- and business stakeholders- to deliver best-in-class BI solutions. The Sr. Analyst will have high visibility and be hands-on at each step of the BI product development lifecycle: identifying the opportunities/root causes of business problems- gathering requirements from stakeholders- translating those requirements to the data engineers- and designing and delivering high-impact- high-value- analytical tools- and data visualizations. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver by nature- with a strong combination of business acumen- technical and design skills- with a passion for continuous learning.

 Responsibilities

 Partnering with BI Manager and cross-functional stakeholders on the design- development- and maintenance of scalable solutions for ongoing metrics- reports- analyses- dashboards- etc. to support analytical and business needs.
 Evaluating business processes- anticipating requirements- uncovering areas for improvement- and developing and implementing solutions.
 End-to-end delivery of BI projects: scoping- planning- developing and delivering Tableau dashboards- managing enhancement requests.
 Effectively communicating with team members and management (up to Sr. Levels)
 Using analytical and statistical rigor to answer ad-hoc business questions and drive business decisions.
 Collaborating with Data Engineers to develop efficient data models with high integrity.
 Managing timelines- competing resources- and prioritization.
 Collaborating with business end-users to validate and test solutions and create documentation.
 Owning and maintaining priority-1 models and dashboards: monitoring usage- surveying end-users on satisfaction- making required enhancements.
 Working with broader BI team to develop strategies to improve overall department effectiveness and efficiency; drive improved data quality and consistency across all data solutions.


 Qualifications

 BS in math- finance- engineering- statistics- business or related discipline is required
 Proven analytical and quantitative skills and ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
 Strong business acumen- interpersonal- communication and negotiation skills
 Ability to influence cross-functional team members
 Excellent Data Visualization skills (Tableau Preferred)
 Highly Proficient with SQL- Tableau- Tableau Prep- Excel
 Motivated self-starter who can effectively work under pressure and manage multiple priorities
 Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills- including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
 Team player who manages collaboratively with the ability to influence management- in some cases without authority
 Strong Technical and Systems orientation
 2+ years in Business Intelligence / Data Analytics / Management Consulting
 Ability to self-direct- multitask- and prioritize a constantly evolving workload


 Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with Snowflake- SAP HANA- Azure
 Experience with statistical/data modelling with R or Python
 Consulting experience
 CPG Industry Experience
 MBA or master’s degree in a quantitative field










About Us



Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company. 
Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.  





Why Us



We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food. 
Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz. 





Office Collaboration & Hybrid Work Environment




We believe our office environment fuels our collaboration, connection & community as an organization and allows our employees to grow toward greatness. We also believe providing a more flexible and agile model is essential in today’s workplace. A majority of our office-based employees will be able to work remotely for up to two days each week. Additionally, employees who are subject to this hybrid model will be eligible to work from anywhere for up to six weeks in a rolling 12-month period (in maximum two-week increments and according to benefits and tax guidelines). Some jobs may be required to be performed fully in office depending on the role’s responsibilities and requirements.




Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require an accommodation to participate in the job application or hiring process should contact NATAI@kraftheinz.com.

As a Lead IT Security Business Analyst, you will enhance our approach to Identity Access Management at Kellogg Company. You’ll drive us toward the future with confidence as you work across teams, assessing our Identity Access Management processes and sharing actionable insights that improve the Identity Management of our worldwide operations. 
Identity Access Management experience required.

 Kellogg is progressing toward unleashing our full potential by the end of 2023. After this portfolio transformation journey is complete, this role will support Kellanova, a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, plant-based foods, and North America frozen breakfast. Learn more about our bold next steps at UnleashingOurPotential.com.

 HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING


 Ensuring Identity Access Management – You’ll provide guidance for the standards, procedures and controls for access management. Contribute both on an individual application basis as well as a global strategic basis to raise the IAM posture across our organization. Perform or assist with internal application access management and security assessments, using both manual effort and testing tools.
 Managing Key Projects – Set the governance standard when new applications are being added or upgraded within key projects at Kellogg Company. We’ll rely on you to expand the application access and security processes into global standards, sharing new insights that improve our security governance and Identity Access. Work with application and system owners and development teams to accurately document system deficiencies, recommend solutions and track remediation activities.
 Demonstrating Thought Leadership – Drive our new standard of global identity access management. You’ll stay up to date on evolving issues in IAM to keep your skills sharp and implement new ideas to ensure the safety and security of our overall corporate information structure. With a commitment to sharing knowledge, you’ll disseminate specialist IAM knowledge to the security and development communities. You’ll also assist program teams and security review service partners to submit, review and assist in remediation of applications.


 YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS


 Identity Access Management experience
 Understanding of application security
 Capacity to set procedures and control documents for IAM
 Ability to risk assess IT projects from an IAM standpoint
 Excellent communication skills and ability to connect at all levels of the organization and has a commitment to innovation and success despite ambiguity
 Knowledge of SAP and other SAAS applications


 WHAT’S NEXT

 After you apply, your application will be reviewed by a real recruiter – not a bot. This means it could take us a little while to get back with you so watch your inbox for updates. In the meantime, visit our How We Hire page to get insights into our hiring process and how to best prepare for a Kellogg interview. If we can help you with a reasonable accommodation throughout the application or hiring process, please USA.Recruitment@kellogg.com. This role takes part in Locate for Your Day, Kellogg’s hybrid way of working that empowers office-based employees to, in partnership with their managers, find a balance between working from home and the office.

 ABOUT KELLOGG COMPANY

 Kellogg Company is a multibillion-dollar company with over 30 thousand employees all over the globe. We are proud to make delicious foods that people love – foods that you grew up with like Frosted Flakes, Cheez It, Eggo, Pop-Tarts, Crunchy Nut, Pringles, as well as innovative foods such as MorningStar Farms, RX bar, and Noodles.

 Our KValues and BetterDays commitments are at the core of who we are, what we believe and what brings us together. We’re proud to say we’ve been awarded with Fortune’s “World’s Most Admired Companies”, DiversityInc’s “Top 50 Companies for Diversity”, Newsweek’s “Most Loved Workplaces”, and many more awards that you can check out here.

 Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion has been part of our DNA since the beginning. Clearly stated in our Code of Ethics “we have respect for individuals of all backgrounds, capability and opinions.” We believe that equity is more than leveling the playing field. It is making sure barriers, both tangible and intangible, are removed. Interested in the numbers? We hold ourselves accountable with our yearly Features report.

 Kellogg is proud to offer industry competitive Total Health benefits (Physical, Financial, Emotional, and Social) that vary depending on region and type of role. Be sure to ask your recruiter for more information!

 Category: Staff

 Job Description:


Basic Function and Responsibility:
Under the leadership of the Controller, the Business Analyst is the first point of contact for technology within the department to manage the business needs of project stakeholders, customers and end users, and develop and help ensure the integrity of the data processes and systems within the Budget/Accounting Services and Procurement departments. This position will have a balanced understanding of the department's business needs and processes as well as relevant technology; they stay abreast of both business and technology trends and understand how similar areas in other institutions are using technology. They are responsible for facilitating, analyzing and understanding the functional relationships between departmental components of the college's administrative systems. Leads the development and implementation of efficient business processes, and the resolution of systems issues will be a primary component of this position. Duties include reimplementation conversion planning and testing, software defect management, module functional support, process oversight and scheduling, functional module training, ad hoc reporting, module representation for cross-system issues and procedural and change management documentation.
Characteristic Duties and Responsibilities:

Provide technical support by functioning as a liaison with the Information Technology department and by monitoring Budget/Accounting Services and Procurement computer application systems. 
Partners with Information Technology to ensure data and process integrity is maintained. 
Elicits, analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of stakeholders. 
Maintain the business office application systems as needed, including reconciling system upgrades, table data maintenance, module testing of upgrades and enhancements, etc. 
Develops and delivers training to Budget/Accounting and Procurement departments and other staff on changes to the application systems. 
Provides leadership in the development and maintenance of departmental procedure manuals for implementation of delivered applications, including upgrades and patches and fixes. 
Attends workshops and other meetings concerning new and/or updated information related to the systems the Budget/Accounting Services and Procurement departments utilize. 
Develops and manages test scripts, scenarios and staff to ensure that patches/fixes to existing systems on new systems or enhancements, communicates changes and modifications of business requirements to project managers or stakeholders to resolve issues timely. Research existing technologies to offer insight and recommendations to departments. 
Interprets complex requests to provide accurate reports that meet the requester's needs. 
Designs and creates queries and reports for data analysis and validation, monitoring processes, and identifying functional problems for audits, quality control of batch and manual processes and other ad hoc data needs as required. 
Uses data reporting tools and languages (SQL) to optimize system efficiency and manipulate and extract data. 
Design, maintain, manipulate, and query databases/data warehouses for financial reporting and analysis 
Manages the technical and functional implementation of recommendations resulting from auditor findings and internal and external complaints. 
Leads continual service improvement in Budget/Accounting Services and Procurement by implementing and maintaining service management solutions to provide centralized monitoring of service requests including reporting and dashboards. 
Proactively works with members of other departments to identify and implement key opportunities for operational improvements, especially with regards to processes and leverage of data/information. 
Complete work according to project plans and time frames. 
Perform other duties job related as assigned.


 Job Requirements:
 Qualifications and Working Conditions:

Bachelor's degree required in Business or closely-related discipline (e.g. Accounting or Finance) with evidence of coursework in information systems, computer science or related technical discipline. 
Master's degree with coursework in Information Systems, Information Technology preferred. 
Minimum 5 years experience working with Ellucian Banner platform, or similar ERP system. 
Demonstrated experience in a similar business analyst role supporting software implementations. 
Oracle database programming experience, preferably with PL/SQL, or an alternate report development tool. 
Must be proactive and able to work independently with limited supervision in a team environment. 
Strong analytical, organization, problem-solving, and documentation skills. 
Must be detailed oriented. 
Demonstrates excellent customer service capabilities to achieve timely and high quality responses. 
Proven ability to lead initiatives, meet deadlines, and deliver results. 
Ability to multi-task and handle multiple projects simultaneously. 
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel. 
Understanding of software development methodologies. 
Mobility to move from building to building on-Campus and to visit off-Campus entities. Work is performed in a general office environment and is sedentary in nature. Little or no exposure to adverse working conditions.

Administrative supervision is received from the Controller.
Supervision Exercised:
None

 Job Summary
 
 The Senior Analyst helps management continually improve processes, operational efficiency, and helps with business development.
 
 The Senior Analyst produces business intelligence by coordinating with cross-functional groups and using data from a variety of internal and external sources to model and report on end-to-end Supply Chain and Business Operations.
 
 This includes developing and maintaining existing systems, procedures, and policies and implementing new ones to ensure Business and Operational Requirements are met. The Senior Analyst will also help prepare and monitor aspects of budgeting and forecasting.
 
 The Senior Analyst will report to the Manager of Business Operations & Analytics.

     Performs analysis, requirement gathering, data analytics, and report preparation related to ongoing business & operations, processes, and services.

job_description:
Job Description Summary Responsible for providing financial planning, analysis and reporting for Corporate, a business, or a P&L within a business. Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market.
 
 GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.
 
 Job Description
 Roles and Responsibilities

 Support the preparation process in the lead up to GEHC Quarterly Earnings, including preparation of the Investor Relations script, relevant back up materials & preparation of Q&A for the earnings call.
 Work closely with all finance and business stakeholders to lead and improve the planning process (yearly budget, 8-quarter forecasting, 3-year long-term strategy outlook).
 Analyze data of key competitors & customers to provide relative market comparisons & put the performance of Patient Care Solutions in context.
 Track performance against externally communicated financial guidance; proactively identify any points of variation & partner with GEHC Group FP&A and Investor Relations team on how to address accordingly.
 Understand market trends, opinions, and reactions to Patient Care Solutions industry and competitors and provide strategic insights that will help inform senior management investment, operating, and financial decisions.


 Required Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED)
 5 years of experience in Finance (or graduate of financial leadership program with 2 year experience)
 Demonstrated ability to work in team-environment
 Ability to build/create new processes that can be automated/repeatable and comfortable navigating financial/non-financial ERPs (e.g. Hyperion, Essbase, Oracle, etc.)
 Strong oral and written communication skills.


 Desired Characteristics

 Experience managing multiple priorities and stakeholders.
 Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems independently.
 Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills.
 Utilizes technical expertise and judgment to solve problems. Leverages technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems.

 We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.

 PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION
 The Senior Analyst, Anti-Fraud will support efforts to prevent, investigate, and advise on potential/actual instances of fraud, waste, and abuse (FWA). Duties include performing or assisting with interviews, driving quantitative/qualitative analysis, and preparing documentation for case files. The position will work closely with the Senior Manager as well as other internal departments, including Compliance & Ethics, Digital Forensics, Insider Threat, HR, and Supply to assess information and draw conclusions on allegations of FWA. He/She/They/Them will also support proactive efforts such as training, and FWA advisement on audits. Are you intellectually curious, detail-oriented, proficient in data analysis, and comfortable working alone and with others? If so, we'd like to meet you.
 PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES

 Support program activities to build capacity across organization such as researching practices, identifying emerging trends, drafting instructional presentations, assisting to deploy fraud risk assessment. Assist with auditor advisement to discern or explore fraud risks during course of audit engagements 
Collaborate with appropriate SMEs to plan and execute research, conduct witness and target interviews, collect and analyze data, and investigate allegations of fraud waste or abuse. 
Document programmatic and investigative activities, synthesize information and ensure factual accuracy of conclusions.
 Assist, as needed, on special projects and initiatives across Exelon Audit Services, 

Job Scope 

Level and depth of supervisory duties - Periodically coach peers and other staff on projects 
Interfaces with various levels of staff, key contributors to certain levels of management. 
Requires ability to adjust pacing to an extensive working knowledge of company policies and the procedures and interdependencies (and the Collective Bargaining Agreement, where applicable). 
Level of independence, decision-making authority - limited but some
Internal and external contact relationships - limited but some 
Number of direct reports (Span of Control) - 0
Budget accountability, impact on asset management, and organization revenue - None 

Qualifications 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

 Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or relevant field
 4-7 years of relevant experience
 Demonstrated ability to drive assignments to conclusion
 Understands requirements for documentation in work papers, written/electronic records and memos; demonstrated ability to document a broad range of technical issues.
 Demonstrated successful use of technology to perform research and analysis
 Strong analytical, written and oral communication skills
 Demonstrated project management skills
 Commitment to highest standards of quality and integrity
 Strong executive presence, high degree of professionalism and embraces inclusive tenets
 Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels within and external to the organization
 Ability to take responsibility and drive high quality execution of fraud specialist efforts, as well as internal firm initiatives
 Effective time management skills and the ability to prioritize when working on multiple engagements
 Interest in identifying and developing junior resources to support fraud initiatives

 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 Certified Fraud Examiner or related certification
 Investigatory or audit experience
 Knowledge of Regulatory, utility or energy industry

As a leader in the MRO industry, we partner with customers to make sure they have the right maintenance and repair parts on hand when needed.
 


 We’re looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst in our Sales Operations department responsible developing, delivering and supporting information-driven business solutions using business intelligence tools and databases. The primary focus of this role will be related to Business Intelligence (BI), Data Visualization and Data Warehousing.
 


 Our corporate headquarters is located in Chicago, IL. This role operates on a hybrid work model; employees spend two days working in the office and three days working remotely. We offer 401k plus vision, dental and medical benefits, as well as a paid holiday and PTO package.
 


 Responsibilities:



 Analyzes, designs, builds, and enhances BI interfaces using Power BI, integrating existing as well as new data from multiple sources to inform leadership, drive strategic and tactical decisions, solve complex business problems, anticipate problems, and fulfill business needs.
 Understands and develops business intelligence solution components, including MS Power BI data model creation, SQL development, database integration, ETL processes, and report and dashboard creation.
 Gathers intelligence data, collaborating with stakeholders to understand and translate their business needs into well-designed and validated BI solutions to improve outcomes and overall performance metrics.
 Designs and delivers accurate reports and insights that analyze business functions, key operations, and performance metrics.
 Maintains databases used for report creation, ad hoc data requests, and reporting processes, assisting with data warehouse enhancements and operations.
 Develops periodic analysis for key internal groups, creating efficient reporting practices and enhancing reporting capabilities, and ensuring reporting is performed in a timely manner.
 Prepares ad hoc analysis for stakeholders, crafting & executing queries against multiple sources upon request.
 Communicates the status of project deliverables, issues, and risks proactively to management.
 Develops and maintains knowledge of the capabilities and functions of BI solutions and related software. Uses this knowledge to recommend optimal solutions to business requirements.
 Creates training documents.
 Other duties as assigned.




 Qualifications & Requirements:



 Bachelor’s Degree required, with a preference in Computer Science or Information Technology, and at least 5 years’ experience in BI development and understanding of database management systems, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
 Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Scientist with in-depth technical and modeling capabilities and professional knowledge across multiple data platforms and technologies
 Understanding of relational databases with a background in data warehouse design and data mining, including Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Servers, Oracle Databases
 Familiarity with BI technologies, data visualization tools, and cloud data platforms: SAP Business Objects, Webi, Analytics Cloud, Macros/VBA, SSMS, Azure Dev Ops, Power BI, Power Pivot, Python, Online Analytical Processing, Extract Transform Load, Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
 Advanced technical skills in areas such as Excel, Access, and SQL
 Strong knowledge of data modeling concepts and experience in designing and implementing data models for applications and/or reporting
 Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving and quantitative skills, combined with excellent written and verbal communication skills
 Results-oriented; able to work independently and take initiative
