company: HITACHI GLOBAL AIR POWER US, LLC
job_description:
Description 
Summary of the position:
 As a Commercial Operations Analyst at Hitachi Global Air Power, a leading compressor manufacturer, your role will be instrumental in supporting the commercial operations team. You will analyze data, provide insights, and optimize business performance to drive operational efficiency, revenue growth, and profitability. With your analytical skills, you will play a critical role in identifying opportunities, improving processes, and ensuring effective decision-making to maximize business outcomes.

 This role reports to the Director of Channel Management and may be based out of 8700 West Bryn Mawr, Chicago, Illinois or One Sullair Way, Michigan City, Indiana. 

Duties and responsibilities:

 Data Analysis and Reporting:

 Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to sales, marketing, and customer trends in the compressor industry.
 Prepare regular reports and dashboards to provide insights on key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales revenue, market share, customer satisfaction, and profitability.
 Identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in data to support strategic decision-making.


 Sales and Forecasting Analysis:

 Collaborate with sales teams to analyze sales performance, identify gaps, and recommend strategies to improve sales effectiveness.
 Conduct sales forecasting and demand planning analysis to optimize inventory management and production planning for compressors.
 Evaluate pricing strategies, sales promotions, and discounts to drive revenue growth while maintaining profitability.


 Market Research and Competitor Analysis:

 Monitor industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscape in the compressor market to identify emerging opportunities or threats.
 Conduct market research and analysis to support new product launches, market expansion, and customer segmentation initiatives.
 Analyze competitor pricing, product offerings, and market positioning to develop competitive strategies.


 Process Improvement and Optimization:

 Identify areas for process improvement within the commercial operations function and propose actionable solutions.
 Streamline workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and enhance data integrity to improve operational efficiency.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain, to implement process improvements and drive alignment.


 Systems and Tools Management:

 Manage and maintain data analytics tools, CRM systems, and other commercial operations platforms.
 Ensure data accuracy, troubleshoot issues, and provide user training and support when needed.
 Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging technologies to recommend system enhancements and optimize data analytics capabilities.

 Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
 Proven experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or similar role, preferably within the manufacturing or industrial sector.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
 Proficiency in data visualization and reporting tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI) to present insights in a clear and concise manner.
 Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., regression analysis, forecasting models) to derive meaningful conclusions from data.
 Solid understanding of sales and marketing principles, supply chain dynamics, and manufacturing operations.
 Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present findings to stakeholders.
 Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
 Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
 Knowledge of CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) and ERP systems is a plus.


 Professional experience:

 At least two years of experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment.


 Key behaviors:

 Strong communication skills
 Keen analytical and problem-solving abilities
 Process-oriented with a continuous improvement mindset
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail


 Direct reports:

 None


 The successful candidate is responsible for complying with Hitachi Global Air Power US Code of Ethics and related policies. In performing the job, the incumbent shall take all steps necessary to comply with our safety rules and requirements and must actively support the organization's efforts to meet and exceed its goals of creating and maintaining a safe workplace.

 This description is to serve as a guide. It is intended to be flexible and will continue to evolve over time with business needs and demands and may be updated periodically and at the Company's discretion.

 Hitachi Global Air Power US is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate based on race, religion, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or other protected categories under applicable law, whether in recruitment, employment, promotion, transfer, compensation, or other conditions of employment.

Job Summary:
 Ice Miller, LLP is seeking an experienced Billing Analyst to join our team. The Billing Analyst will provide high level support to our practice groups, manage the delivery and processing of invoices through various electronic systems, and work collaboratively with the pricing team to advise attorneys on the firm’s pricing and fee options as needed. This position requires excellent attention to detail and effective communication across teams. The employee must be capable of working in a fast-paced environment with time-sensitive materials and maintain strict confidentiality due to the nature of the position.

      New York salary in the range of $36.42 to $43.59 dependent on experience level.
    
 Essential Job Duties:

Perform full-cycle billing functions for attorneys including but not limited to bills, client statements, audit letters, third party, and non-client disbursements
Liaise with attorneys and practice group leaders regarding billing requirements and delinquent and partial billing
Provide insight and guidance to practice group leaders and partners regarding pricing options to maximize profitability
Manage client billing cycles and be knowledgeable about client contractual agreements and relationships
Proactively seek ways to improve billing process
Monitor and update new clients and maters for required billing guidelines, invoice formats/settings, discount and rate arrangements
Handle mid month and month end proforma runs with assistance from billing supervisor
Demonstrate an ability to be proactive and provide best-in-class service to attorneys, staff, vendors and clients by being professional and responsive
Understand the Firm’s electronic billing system and process ebilling invoices as needed
Identify trends and issues with performance in relation to practice group profitability and client fee agreements
Ensure data accuracy in intake process
Understand and utilize systems to maintain information
Run reports, analyze data and prepare spreadsheets
Provide training on new software
Lead billing and timekeeping system-related orientation sessions for new team members
Assist in developing procedures and documentation
Compare and analyze financial data to propose billing solutions
Review and understand discounting, rates, pricing, and volume discounts
Stay up to date and educate attorneys on the firm’s alternative fee options
Handle billing spark box and overflow as needed
Acts as a backup to team members and be proactive in assisting others to ensure deadlines are met timely
Process electronic invoicing of clients using client-determined external websites
Process and mail final copies of invoices (in all formats)
Understand technical aspects of billing software and utilize systems to maintain information
Resolve inquiries and issues related to billing functions
Bring aging WIP to Management’s attention and analyze for handling twice a year; mainly during year end close
Performs other duties as assigned or required to meet Firm goals and objectives

 Minimum Requirements:

Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting related field preferred; High School Diploma required
Strong bookkeeping background
Must be a self-starter with a high level of initiative
Experience of electronic billing sites and eBillingHub, required
Experience of Ledes and XML formats, required
Prior experience working in a professional services or law firm setting, preferred
Continuous learner seeking out additional supervisory responsibilities
Strong analytical skills and ability to use data for process improvement and efficiencies
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office products
Able to adapt to fast pace work environment
Ability to multi-task and effectively manage time
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects
Strong technology skills and ability to learn and teach others new software
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and to prioritize duties and use good judgment
Strong interpersonal skills necessary to deal courteously and effectively with a diverse group of people, both on the phone and in person
Integral team player for the billing team
Must be able to perform all essential duties

 Candidates must have permanent authorization to work in the United States.
 Ice Miller LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

LogicGate was founded with a rebellious spirit and lofty objective: to build a modern risk management platform that helps our customers grow by transforming business risks into opportunities. Since our founding in 2015, we've secured more than $156M in four funding series to help us grow into the company we are today, but we're not done yet. LogicGate continues to push to lead the GRC category with our flexible and no-code risk management solution.We are an outcomes-first company. Our success comes from our high-performing teams, so we give you flexibility to work from where you are. You'll have the option to be fully remote, work from our headquarters in Chicago, or hybrid, unless the role has specific requirements.Risk is a team sport, and the strongest teams are made up of diverse talent. We've worked hard to create an environment where everyone feels safe bringing their most authentic self to work. We are committed to fostering and maintaining an inclusive work environment where all employees' views and backgrounds are celebrated, their thoughts matter and everyone feels safe to bring their authentic selves to work.Our Company core values of Be as One, Do the Right Thing, Embrace Curiosity, Own It, Empower Customers, and Raise the Bar guide everything we do - with our customers, our employees, and all we interact with.We are proud to have been included as a top workplace by Built In, Crain's Chicago Business, and the Chicago Tribune.
About the RoleExciting opportunity to jump-start your career with exposure to executive mentors at a leading software company in the GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) market. We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a GRC Advisory Analyst to support customer workshops, with the goal of delighting customers by delivering winning strategies and solutions to help reduce risk and increase operational efficiency.How you'll spend your time:

Coordinate and manage the overall pipeline of workshops, keeping all internal stakeholders informed and driving next steps
Collaborate with the GRC Advisory team to create/update internal program materials and resources (e.g., workshop templates, process documents)
Support customer workshops by project managing workshop pre- and post-work tasks, capturing notes during customer calls, identifying and tracking action items, assisting with scheduling, developing customer deliverables and executive presentations
Help compile monthly reports on team metrics, including pulling data from Risk Cloud and Salesforce
Collaborate with Marketing to develop content to drive more interest in GRC Maturity Workshops, including customer case studies & testimonials
Assist with other GRC Advisory team projects as needed

We get excited about you if you have:

Strong communication skills with the ability to clearly convey ideas in written or graphic form to produce high-quality, professional client deliverables including technical summary reports and executive presentation slide decks.
Experience using spreadsheets to analyze data and quickly summarize and extract useful insights.Proficiency in collaborative technologies (i.e. Office 365, Google Suite, Zoom, Slack).
Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and interest in helping to build and improve processes as part of a scaling team.
Provide research within targeted accounts to identify key contacts and critical account information prior to prospecting touches
Contribute to every component of the critical functions associated with fulfilling the sales cycle (forecasting, reporting, customer database maintenance, and data entry, correspondence, and communications)
Proactively build knowledge of company product and understand the competitive landscape via researching websites, online webinars, and marketing information

We get excited about you if you have:

Passion about technology and excited to grow a career in sales
Curious and desire to understand the GRC space through industry research

The anticipated base salary range for the role is $62,000 - $78,000 per year + variable + equity + benefits. Actual salaries may vary and will be based on factors, such as candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies and proficiency for the role. Internal candidates who have current pay within or above the hiring range are still encouraged to apply if interested.Total RewardsOur Total Rewards Package is designed to support you both at work and outside of it. In addition to offering competitive salary, variable compensation (bonus), equity and health and wellness benefits, we are proud to offer generous PTO, 12 Annual Company Holidays, Summer and Winter Fridays, and Health Days, allowing you time to recharge and relax. We are focused on and invested in career development and learning opportunities including access to LinkedIn Learning, regular People Leader training, our internal Mentorship Program, and and annual Continued Education stipend ($1,000 per year per person).Our CultureDEIB is a priority for us at LogicGate - it is at the foundation of all of our core People programs, activities, and business practices. We encourage everyone to join one of our Employee Affinity Groups (BELogicGate, Women in LogicGate, and Pride) to participate in and contribute to conversations that foster a culture of belonging.LogicGate also believes strongly in giving back to the communities in which we live and work. We support our teams through this by offering volunteer hours as well as Company-wide charitable activities supporting organizations aligned with our Company Core Values.Excited about LogicGate but not familiar with GRC? That's ok — a lot of us weren't familiar with GRC when we started, too. Unless the job description specifically requires previous GRC familiarity, here's what you need to know:

GRC stands for Governance, Risk, and Compliance
GRC professionals help their companies manage uncertainty, act with integrity, and stay on the right side of the law.
GRC is a huge market and growing fast. It's a $35 billion industry today, and predicted to grow to $64 billion by 2025. A lot of opportunity!

Description: 
  The International Code Council (ICC) is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist to join our finance team and provide insights and recommendations to support our strategic decision-making. This position will be responsible for preparing and analyzing financial reports, budgets, forecasts, and KPIs using PowerBI and other tools.
 As a Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist, you will work closely with senior management and various business units to understand their performance drivers to provide reporting and data analysis support. You will also develop and maintain financial models and Business Intelligence dashboards to support business planning and analysis. To be successful in this role, you should have a bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related field, and at least 5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist or a similar role. You should also have strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills, as well as proficiency in PowerBI, Excel, and other financial software.
 Responsibilities:

 Gathers business intelligence from sources including, but not limited to, company data, industry reports, public data, or qualitative data from business staff.
 Analyzes financial data and prepares reports, provides forecasting support through modeling, and prepares projections based on financial data.
 Compiles business intelligence on sales, membership, member behavior, and benefits and conducts statistical analyses to develop strategies and support actionable recommendations.
 Uses business intelligence data and tools to identify and monitor current and potential members.
 Assists business managers in establishing and tracking KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions.
 Identifies data patterns and trends to propose solutions and strategies to business challenges or new projects.
 Produces reports, timelines, and graphics to communicate progress on projects or goals to management.
 Summarizes and interprets data information using data visualization techniques and creates reports and dashboards for review by executives and managers.
 Creates and maintains consistent systems to produce visualizations and dashboards in scheduled timeframes through Microsoft Power BI.
 Maintains current knowledge of data storage and management best practices and ensures data integrity and quality.
 Provides recommendations regarding the evolution of data and reporting systems.
 Documents all processes and data used in data summaries or analyses.
 Collaborates with business staff across the company to understand the needs of the company and responds to inquiries for support.
 Performs related duties for all departments and subsidiaries who request data or analytical support.
 Requirements: 
  Requirements:
 Essential Skills and Education / Experience:

 Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, information technology, finance or a related field
 5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst/Data Scientist or a similar role
 Strong analytical, problem-solving, organization, and critical thinking skills
 Attention to detail and accuracy.
 Ability to communicate complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.
 Proficiency in PowerBI, Excel, and other financial software
 Experience developing and optimizing complex SQL queries.
 Perform complex data queries and data analysis, including integrating data from disparate data sources.
 Ability to work independently as well as collaborate within a team environment.
 Collaborate across all levels of the organization and with cross functional teams.
 Great Plains and/or Dynamics F/O experience preferred

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve.

 Citi’s Personal Banking and Wealth Management (PBWM) division is building a purpose-driven team to serve its globally diverse, digitally forward customers in top cities around the world. We’re looking for exceptional candidates who think digitally and differently, resolve problems in unconventional ways and strive to provide a remarkable experience for our clients

 Overview of the Role
 Citi’s PBWM Technology (PBWMT) organization serves the PBWM global suite of products providing a full range of innovative and comprehensive set of services. Our businesses also offer industry-leading advanced technology, a strong worldwide presence and a powerful global franchise.

 The Senior Data Analyst is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. The person is a recognized technical authority for an area within the business and requires basic commercial awareness. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince colleagues in other areas and external customers. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.  Responsibilities:

 As the Data and Analytics subject matter expert, design and help build data warehouses, analytical solutions and software tools for NAM data domain covering new and emerging business demand.
 The lead Business/Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in understanding the vision and strategy of business partners and stakeholders. Work closely with the business users to source emerging business use cases such as onboarding or ingesting new third party or partner data types, building data marts or producing new visualization and reporting. 
Work with the business users to understand the ask in detail, ensuring that the requirements are documented, the data and technical design are fit for purpose and concerns are analyzed and addressed in a timely manner.
 Enable teams to production of functional requirements documents, data mapping documents, maintaining end-to-end requirements traceability, and reviewing the test plan and cases as required
 Look for opportunities to simplify our data ecosystem and perform research and development on new technology solutions such as Cloud enablement. 
Provide in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop innovative solutions.
 Ensure design and control standards are adhered to for all data projects and work with delivery teams to take any open design issues to resolution
 Create clear processes and framework for transparent documentation on existing data flows and determine gaps in solution that may impact requirements.
 Change Management Advocate - Innovate and generate new ideas, concepts, and models to improve methods of obtaining and evaluating quantitative and qualitative data. Question and validate assumptions and status quo. Escalate identified risks and sensitive areas in terms of methodology and processes
 Display critical thinking in the creation of succinct narrative reports, presentations and visual mappings to report analytical assessments. Display data and the results of analysis in clear straightforward business report that can be understood by non-technical readers.
 Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers.
 Produces detailed analysis of issues where the best course of action is not evident from the information available, but actions must be recommended/ taken.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:

 6+ years of experience within IT data and analytics function in a large, matrixed organizations; proven track record in supporting transformation and change and the ability to connect the dots to the organizational priorities
 Strong interpersonal, problem-solving and communication skills to proactively address business questions and the ability to understand trade-offs and impacts across business and technology processes to cultivate a 'no surprises' approach
 Strategic, analytical, and systematic thinker who consistently challenges the status quo and constructively challenges the team to drive change and continuous improvement.
 Good understanding of technical architecture and design considerations, experience with the data flow, data marts and metadata through interconnected applications so as to support capture, organization, movement, transformation, storage and consumption of data
 Enterprise Data platforms, data solutions, data Warehouse/ETL design and development methodologies knowledge and experience required.
 Strong technical background including software programming using SQL, Java, Scala or Python, Big Data tooling such as Spark, Hadoop and data visualization tools. Experience working with Cloud based data warehouse systems such as Snowflake on AWS or GCP will be preferred.

 Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree

About HUB 

 As one of the world’s largest insurance brokers, HUB provides clients with the peace of mind that what matters most will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put our clients in control. Our growing team of professionals across North America represents a broad, deep and one-of-a kind aggregation of entrepreneurs and leaders recognized for their excellence throughout the insurance community. 

 Job overview 

 As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join a new digital team at HUB called to VIU by HUB to help build the leading digital brokerage of the future through expert advice and new features delivered in a delightful experience that is fast and seamless - whenever, wherever and however the customer chooses. Your data acumen and curiosity will be leveraged to help consumers just like you experience what the future of an insurance relationship with customers should be. You will join a team that is always striving to offer a fresh perspective for insurance consumers and their diverse lives through new analytics and a new flexible platform. 

 We're not chasing the status quo; we're chasing a shared vision of tomorrow. If you’re up for an exciting adventure to build something big, we’d love for you to join the VIU by HUB team to revolutionize the insurance marketplace. 

 You will leverage deep analytics and customer insights to unlock new revenue and efficiencies. You will manage cross-functional relationships and reporting for multiple stakeholders, from Tech, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Executive level data needs. You will translate business questions into appropriate analytical projects that will inform strategic and tactical business decisions and be able to conduct analysis to communicate insights quickly. Ultimately, your passion for analytics will allow you to become a future analytics leader. 

 Job Requirements 

 3+ years data mining large data. 

 2+ years of experience with SQL required for role. Experience with Python a plus. 

 SQL – exploration, joining tables, validating results 

 Python – translating complex analyses into code (pandas), visualizations. 

 Excel power user. 

 Ability to understand and interpret data models. 

 Self-driven to understand business meaning behind data from multiple systems, relationships between systems and datasets, and able to interpret and communicate data to stakeholders. 

 Working Conditions 

 Work from home or in the office at HUB’s US headquarters in Chicago, IL. If WFH, expectation is travel to office as needed to facilitate role responsibilities.

 Business Analyst – Build (Data Analytics)
Fantastic opportunity to join an industry leader and make a difference on a key team! Medline has experienced double-digit growth for 54 of the past 55 years, and we keep growing. If you have an interest in Business analyst - Build (Data Analystics), you'll want to check this out!
Job Description
Summary
In this role you’ll be responsible for project planning, execution, and implementation of changes to Business Intelligence, Data Engineering and reporting solutions as well as ensuring accurate and timely data solutions delivery to business partners. Determine and develop user requirements for systems in production, to ensure maximum usability. You will work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment that requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable in working with multiple business and technical teams. Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of systems development. To be successful in the role, you need strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills, and the ability to influence across business functions and manage stakeholders’ expectations effectively.
Responsibilities

Responsible for working closely with the team and business sponsors to understand business requirements and drive the design and delivery of quality technical solutions.
Responsible for project management of large BI solution projects/initiatives including scope, budget and timeline management.
Responsible for defining acceptance criteria with business liaisons. Supporting business users during acceptance testing, production migration, and post go-live support. 
Involved in reviewing BI enhancements during all project phases – requirements gathering, design, testing, implementation, and issue resolution.
Possess an in-depth understanding of the business function/process supported, and also be viewed as a credible representative of that business function/process
Working closely with the team to ensure on-time delivery of quality solutions with minimal rework.
Responsible for BI solutions effort estimation and making decisions regarding resource allocations.
Responsible for driving continuous improvement within the team processes and deliverables.
Responsible for working closely with the manager to prioritize business issues team’snew initiatives, and set the team direction.
Influence business leadership and management decisions and drive ownership and acceptance of changes to the business.
Responsible for product ownership and working with business partners for improvements to drive business.




 
COVID-19 Vaccination
Please be aware that Medline requires all employees starting in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated by their start date. Medline is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodations to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated for COVID-19 consistent with federal, state, and local law.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field; or equivalent work experience
Skill Requirements

4+ Years of experience working with design/development teams through a full development lifecycle
Skilled with data analysis, data visualization, data engineering, reporting & analytics. Working knowledge of SQL.
Outstanding project and resource management skills.
Experience working with offshore teams
Strong prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills
Ability to test and document end-to-end processes. Proficient in MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio) software
Demonstrates collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team
Ability to work with and influence peers and management
Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to translate business processes or concepts into technical requirements are essential. More about Medline: Medline is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets. Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $17 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values. Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For,” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.

About Waterton
 Waterton has grown from very humble beginnings with one phone and two desks to the successful, nationally recognized real estate investment and management firm it is today. As Waterton has evolved and grown, one thing has remained constant - the drive to achieve results by exceeding expectations. For 25 years Waterton remains passionate about delivering an incredible Resident Experience, which we believe is made possible by offering an extraordinary experience for our talented associates. We value performance that delivers experiences that exceed expectations, coupled with an unwavering commitment to Investor, Guest, and Resident service excellence. Overall we are a collection of people who strive daily to “find the good and leave it better”.
 Job Summary
 The Business Analyst (Business Intelligence Analyst or BI Analyst) plays a key role in proliferating a data driven mindset throughout Waterton. As a liaison between IT and business lines, the analyst will utilize various tools and skillsets using formal and informal data to help end users define and achieve their goals. The analyst will collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives and develop solutions via reporting and/or analysis. Analysts own projects from inception through delivery and communicate outcomes across various disciplines and roles throughout the firm.
 Your Impact and Job Responsibilities

Work closely with business leaders to identify opportunities to deliver reporting that supports new and ongoing business objectives
Develop and promote creative data visualizations, reports, tools and dashboards to derive actionable real-time insights using Microsoft Power BI and other applications
Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions to increase efficiency and streamline existing processes
Develop project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
Monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and report results regularly to various stakeholders across the firm, from senior leadership to front line community staff
Ensure data and reporting are accurately represented by agreed upon business requirements and source systems
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to project, technical and BI objectives
Develop, execute and monitor simple to moderately complex data management and analytic processes to support report delivery
Partner with technologists and execute test scripts in accordance with an agreed upon validation plan. Assist in root cause analysis when expectations are not met
Be the subject matter expert for all reporting and data available in the Business Intelligence ecosystem

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Education

Bachelor’s degree in business or Computer Science with an emphasis in finance, MIS, computer science or a related field preferred
Advanced degree a plus
Any technical, business or academic designations are a plus

1-3 years of analytical experience and/or financial experience preferred
A team-player with a collaborative spirt that can also work independently as needed
Working at a faster than average pace for most of the workday. Must feel comfortable working on new projects without significant oversight or detailed direction
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills with a strong understanding of analytic/statistical concepts with the ability to explain them to others
Excellent time management skills. Ability to communicate and prioritize effectively to ensure continuous progress is made toward stated goals/objectives
Strong organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking
Intermediate to Advanced in Microsoft Excel, including writing complex formulas and pivot tables
Familiar with a data visualization tools, such as: Power BI, Tableau, QlikView and/or Looker.
Basic understanding of how to run queries in within a relational database.

How we will recognize and reward you:
 At Waterton, we recognize that compensation and benefits are important not only to our associates but to their families as well. We offer a wide variety of rewards to meet everyone’s needs including:

Competitive compensation and incentive program participation
Full suite of benefits, including Medical, Dental, Life, Disability, and even pet insurance
401k + match
Generous paid time off, volunteer time off, and paid holidays
A commitment to life-long learning through learning plans that include internal and external trainings, as well as consideration for tuition reimbursement.
Employee discounts and wellness initiatives, like an onsite gym.
Hybrid work environment (based on business or position needs)

Waterton welcomes all.
 Waterton is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Description 
We're powering a cleaner, brighter future.  Exelon is leading the energy transformation, and we're calling all problem solvers, innovators, community builders and change makers. Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.  We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies - Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power & Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).  In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.  Are you in?  PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION
 The role will provide subject matter expertise on the use of analytical and quantitative techniques to enable data-driven insights and efficient EAS engagements. The SME will possess advanced hands on experience in the use of data analytical and visualization tools, expert knowledge on analytical techniques such as data transformation, comparative analytics, frequency distribution, pattern analysis, trend analysis and statistical analyses. The SME will have and understanding of Exelon's applications, platforms and databases, which serve as data sources, including the associated risks and controls.
 Individual will be responsible for the coordination and execution of core assurance and business enablement activities, including business risk assessment activities, design and operational effectiveness testing, and evaluation of control failures while serving as a liaison to business partners to ensure that the companies risk management, governance and internal control processes are operating effectively.
 Individual will support other business initiatives and will be responsible for expressing opinions and providing insight on the adequacy and effectiveness of the control environment while identifying and communicating continuous improvement, control optimization and risk mitigation opportunities to business partners.
 PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES

Coordinate and execute analytics projects to support core assurance and business enablement activities leveraging our common assurance and enablement framework. Includes the preparation and delivery of data visualization summaries to support formal communications and informed insights on the adequacy and effectiveness of business processes and internal controls.
Provide active coaching and support of others to build EAS team capabilities in the use of analytics, visualization and data modeling techniques. enable a high performing learning organization
Manage, administer and maintain the EAS data analytics platform in conjunction with BSC-IT Infrastructure team to ensure resource availability.
Provide Insight on the adequacy and effectiveness of the control environment while identifying and communicating continuous improvement, control optimization and risk mitigation opportunities to business partners and EAS related to Data Analytics
Support other business initiatives to continuously improve internal processes that optimize internal controls and reduce total cost of controls, within Audit Services and across business process areas.

 JOB SCOPE
 Individual will be expected to demonstrate the following skill areas with some consistency.

Analytical - applies critical thinking and intellectual curiosity to solve complex problems with various tools and techniques. Demonstrates rapid learning and agility to proactively and effectively factor cost of controls into defining issues and issue resolution. Helps to optimize and simplify business processes.
Communication - provides clear written and verbal communication while actively engaging and leveraging active listening skills. Adapts messaging based on audience and situation while exhibiting strong understanding of the business. Constructively challenges issues through use of crucial conversations.
Individual will be expected to consistently demonstrate the following skill areas while being capable in aiding others.
Talent Development - applies situational leadership to provide feedback and actively engage with others. Leverages coaching to enhance talent development and to build skills and capabilities. Able to translate feedback into action while self-identifying development areas and career opportunities. Actively demonstrates emotional intelligence and self-awareness.
Risk and Controls Mastery - Demonstrates ability to identify, assess and mitigate risk using a holistic perspective, as well as formulating action plans to achieve desired business outcomes. Applies professional judgement and strong understanding of company control frameworks and processes, to strengthen the control environment while preventing and detecting fraud.

 Qualifications 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, Business, Engineering, Finance or equivalent degree
5+ years of professional work experience, compiling, analyzing and visualizing data
In-depth knowledge of database design and proficiency in database query languages such as SQL
Working knowledge or experience with IT processes and IT general controls (e.g., access management, change management, incident management)
Demonstrated understanding of testing concepts for IT dependent controls and IT general controls

 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Relevant professional accreditation (e.g. CIA, CISA, CFE, CPA, PMP, Six Sigma)
Working knowledge of COSO Framework and Sarbanes-Oxley Act
Proficient in analytic tools including but not limited to ETL (SSIS), Power BI, Reporting Tools (Hyperion, OBIEE, Business Objects), ACL, SQL

About the Role
 The transportation industry has no shortage of complex problems requiring creative solutions to scale efficiently. In this role, you will work closely with a team Engineers to gather, manage, and prioritize reporting requirements while collaborating with Product and Client Services to deliver best in class analytics to address industry problems.


 Responsibilities

Understand and become the subject matter expert on multiple software team initiatives working on the Mastermind Product
Analyze, clarify, and validate business needs
Craft detailed technical user stories based on product requirements
Define acceptance criteria and test user stories to ensure quality
Help teams triage, investigate and resolve defects
Manage dependencies and cross-team coordination
Act as a liaison between Product and Engineering
Develop an understanding of Mastery's users and act as an advocate for their needs



 Qualifications

4+ years of experience as a BA in an Agile SaaS environment
Ability to work independently to meet objectives
Strong communication (written and verbal) and meeting facilitation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences
Jira experience
API/backend testing experience
Experience in logistics industry a plus
Project Management or Agile certification a plus



 About Mastery
 Mastery Logistics Systems is building the world’s first lovable Transportation Management System, or TMS.
 Our customers – large transportation companies and shippers who need those companies – have struggled with systems that are outdated or inadequate. As shippers or transportation service providers, our customers have in the past been forced to use multiple systems to manage dedicated fleet operations, outsourced or insourced trans management, one way trucking, truckload brokerage, LTL, and Intermodal, or to sub-optimize one or more of those functions by attempting to fit it into a TMS that is adequate at another function.
 Mastermind TMS allows our customers to bring all of these functions into a single platform, providing flexibility, visibility, control, and efficiency. Today’s unprecedented global supply chain upheavals underscore how important the transportation industry is. We are building a system to allow this industry to work faster, smarter and more efficiently.
 The challenges in this industry are big and exciting! We are tackling everything from fast and efficient data input to ingesting large amounts of data and applying AI to looking at blockchain to securely digitize paperwork. If you are passionate about humanizing an industry, automating in innovative ways, building for quality and scale, helping make people's lives easier and touching every part of our economy then this is the place for you.
 Mastery Logistics Systems is committed to continuing to build an incredible company. We are a masterful mosaic of incredible people. We are specialists and experienced in our respective fields. We are dedicated to continuous improvement both professionally and personally. We are a collective group of really good people. We have different interests, backgrounds & talents and we work together to create really cool stuff! We believe in diversity of thought and are mindful and inclusive. We have deep respect for each other and work diligently at adding the right people to our teams.
 We have flexible schedules but share in the mission that we are building and need to get it done. We offer an excellent suite of benefits. We are dedicated to finding new ways to add perks as we live and work from home.
 Our team has the domain knowledge and connections to make an impact, and we’re looking for experienced and thoughtful people to who thrive on creating and building great products. We want people who have a true passion for servicing and taking care of our customers. We need people who are flexible problem solvers, thrive on collaboration and consistently know how to communicate their solutions well. We are small and nimble – which is evident in how quickly we could pivot to our new reality. Each member of the team can make a tremendous impact both technically and culturally. While a start-up, we are well-funded, have an initial paying customer with which to test and launch, and are founded by top experts and veterans in the logistics industry.
 Join us – you’ll love it – let’s build a masterpiece!


 Benefits
 Mastery takes great pride in providing our employees a robust and highly competitive benefit package. Our benefits include Medical, Dental and Vision insurance, company paid Life insurance for 1x salary, Legal, AD&D, Additional Life and other employee assistance benefits. We have a 401k savings plan with a 4% match. We provide opportunities for professional growth and development. We have a manage your life and schedule Paid Time Off program. We are fully devoted to finding creative perks and benefits since we cannot currently enjoy our cool office culture. Our philanthropic partner is St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.


 We are an equal opportunity employer and actively seek a diverse community of professionals. Veterans, Women, non-binary, people of color, LGBTQIA, we welcome all to apply!

 Accepting applications until August 2, 2023.
.
The Office of the Inspector General (OIG), Center for Information Technology and Analytics (CITA) has a new opportunity for an individual(s) who love problem-solving and is civic minded, who is interested in designing, building, and implementing analytical models and visualizations to provide OIG with facts and insights to promote economy, effectiveness, efficiency, and integrity in City government. Under guidance, this position develops and employs innovative techniques for data analysis, resulting in the extraction of critical, near real-time information.
DUTIES:

Under the guidance of a Chief Forensic Data Analyst, extracts, merges, and conducts analysis of large data sets from multiple external data sources
Performs quality reviews of large volumes of data sets, resolves discrepancies, duplicates, missing information, and validates information
Compiles, develops, and generates statistical and narrative reports to summarize findings
Develops, maintains, and manages dashboards and other BI solutions
Develops basic to moderate SQL queries to extract and manage data
Recognizes business requirements and devises solutions to meet data requirements
Prepares reports, documents process, and provides project presentations
Performs related duties as required

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION: Bachelor’s degree plus two years of work experience in data analysis/management OR fact-finding research, analysis and reporting of which one year is in programming and modifying computer applications, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a degree in Data Science, Predictive Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Management, or related field
Work experience in an investigatory or law enforcement organization
Work experience with data visualization software products, e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.

MODERATE KNOWLEDGE OF:

Quantitative data analysis methods
Methods and techniques of data base analysis and design
Tools to query and analyze data in a relational database
Software and data management tools such as R, Tableau, Python, SPSS, MySQL, Oracle or other similar tools
Structured Query Language (SQL) and reporting platforms
Data mining processes and tools
Report writing to summarize findings/results

ANNUAL SALARY: Range: $69,984 – $114,012 (annual increase first three years)
Starting $69,984 (non-negotiable); Post six-month review $73,332.
TRAVEL AND SCHEDULE: Travel outside Chicago is not required. Standard work hours are 8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m., flexibility permitted.
RESIDENCY REQUIREMENT: Employees must be a resident of the City of Chicago and proof of residency is required at the commencement of employment.
OWING OF CITY DEBT: Municipal Code of Chicago 2-152-150 prohibits the hiring of anyone who owes any debt to the City of Chicago.
KNOWLEDGE SKILL AND ESSAY REQUIREMENT: A passing score on a knowledge skill test(s) and/or essay may be require. 
Your application must include answers to the following two prompts:


In less than 500 words, please describe a specific life experience(s) or circumstance(s) in which you encountered adversity, resistance, obstacles, or failure. Describe how you overcame and/or handled the situation(s), with further consideration of what you learned that you believe gives you insights into the lived experience of residents and/or operations of institutions in a city like Chicago.


In less than 500 words, please describe a City of Chicago data source you think OIG should analyze: (1) why the data is important, (2) what aspect of the data you would analyze, (3) how you would visualize the information, (4) and what you would expect to learn. You can find examples of City data sources OIG has analyzed here: https://informationportal.igchicago.org/.


EMPLOYEE VACCINATION REQUIREMENT: City of Chicago employees must, as a condition of employment, be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective October 15, 2021. This Policy applies to all City employees. If you are not able to receive the vaccine for medical or religious reasons, you may seek approval for an exemption in accordance with applicable City processes.
For more information on the vaccine policy, please visit: www.chicago.gov/city/en/depts/dhr/supp_info/city-of-chicago-employee-vaccination-policy.html.
WE VALUE DIVERSITY
The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is an equal opportunity employer.
OIG is an inclusive organization that hires and develops all its staff of all levels regardless of race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, ancestry, marital or parental status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, age, veteran status, and all other characteristics protected by law.
OIG strives to create the kind of workplace where a socially diverse mix of people can thrive professionally. We pride ourselves in meeting our legal charge to promote economy, effectiveness, efficiency, and integrity in government. Through the hard work of our passionate and innovative team, OIG aims to serve every community with equity, respect, and dignity.
If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation due to disability or pregnancy to participate in the application process, please contact the OIG’s Supervisor of Personnel Administration Eloise Markham at emarkham@igchicago.org. Please be prepared to provide information in support of your reasonable accommodation request.
THE CITY OF CHICAGO IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY AND MILITARY FRIENDLY EMPLOYER
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. The City of Chicago does not participate in E-Verify (Employment Eligibility Verification System). In addition, employment at the Office of Inspector General is contingent upon a satisfactory criminal background check.

We are looking for an intrinsically motivated individual to be a key member of the Salesforce Business Analyst team that helps VTS scale. This role is a unique opportunity to manage commissions and work as a Salesforce administrator improving workflow and design and all integrated tools. This position will interact frequently with other departments including Marketing, Sales, Finance and Customer Success, and will allow you to have first-hand exposure into the inner-workings of a Revenue org at a growing SaaS company.
 This job requires you to be in office 3 days a week.
 Here's what you can expect as a Salesforce Business Analyst:

Oversee the monthly sales commissions using software
Manage day-to-day Salesforce configuration, administrative support, maintenance and improvement of the platform, including profile & user management, roles, standard and custom objects, reports and automation
QA and validate changes that impact the existing system through Salesforce
Assist with managing 3rd party app Integrations and configurations for apps such as CaptivateIQ, RingLead, Rollup Helper and DocuSign
Monitor, review and cleanse internal data using reports and dashboards
Document and conduct regular training on Salesforce enhancements, sales processes, etc


You should apply if you have:

Salesforce administration experience
Strong analytical skills, including intermediate level Excel skills (Pivot tables, vlookups, etc.)
Experience in data migration and integrating 3rd party systems with Salesforce



What VTS Values & How We Show It

Strive for Excellence - We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!
Be Customer Obsessed - We're employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - quarterly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!
Be Curious - Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!
Move as One - We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.
Take Ownership - Be an owner of the company you're building with our equity packages.
Appreciate the Difference - VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!




ABOUT VTS


VTS is the commercial real estate industry's only technology company that unifies owners, operators, brokers, and tenants in a single platform to capitalize on opportunities revealed in every square foot of their properties. In 2013, VTS revolutionized the commercial real estate industry's leasing operations with what is now VTS Lease. Today, the VTS Platform is the largest first-party data source in the industry, transforming how strategic decisions are made and executed by CRE professionals across the globe.

 With the VTS Platform, consisting of VTS Lease, VTS Market, VTS Activate, and VTS Data, every business stakeholder in commercial real estate is given real-time market information and workflow tools to do their job with unparalleled speed and intelligence. VTS is the global leader, with more than 60% of Class A office space in the U.S., and 12 billion square feet of office, retail, and industrial space is managed through our platform worldwide. VTS' user base includes over 45,000 CRE professionals and industry-leading customers such as Blackstone, Brookfield Properties, LaSalle Investment Management, Hines, BXP, Oxford Properties, JLL, and CBRE.

 VTS maintains offices in New York City, London, Toronto, and Chicago.
 To learn more about VTS and view our open roles, visit us at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.



EEO Guidelines


    VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
   


    All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. For more information about what we collect and how we use it, please refer to the Candidate Privacy Statement.
   


    If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know at ta@vts.com
   



Privacy Policy

Are you a strategic thinker who loves organizing complex requirements into strategic plans and has a passion for helping clients succeed?
 We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our Strategy Team at Adage Technologies. If you’re a skilled problem solver with an analytical mindset for documenting requirements and an empathetic approach to participating in discovery workshops and user interviews for large clients with complex technical projects, you’ll be a great fit.
 THE DIFFERENCE WE MAKE
 At Adage, we do our part to make businesses run better and faster through technology. We have spent the last 20+ years helping clients transform how they do business through expert digital strategy, user-centered design, and software development.
 Our team consists of people who are incredibly smart, inspiringly driven, impressively kind, and always willing to help. We are routinely recognized as one of Chicago's Best and Brightest Companies to Work For, one of the Best Places to Work in Illinois, and on Crain's Best Places to Work in Chicago.
 THE IMPACT YOU’LL HAVE
 As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with client stakeholders to understand their business objectives and requirements and collaborate with your scrum teams to develop meaningful solutions. You’ll collaborate with client teams through discovery workshops to align objectives, gather requirements, and connect strategy to business objectives. Using empathy and attention to detail, you’ll identify and propose strategic opportunities to improve workflows, systems, and business processes for mission-driven organizations, associations, and non-profits.
 You’ll use your knowledge and experience to:

 Collaborate with the User Experience Lead, your Scrum teams, and client leads to ensure the efficient flow of information and communication across all teams.
 Document requirements and work with the Project Owner to ensure user stories are accurately created to fulfill the design, technical, and business needs.
 Comfortably present findings and high-level recommendations to executive stakeholders.
 Proactively suggest alternative solutions and anticipate potential issues, taking steps to mitigate them before they arise.
 Leverage knowledge of the Adage technical ecosystem and emerging technologies to improve project outcomes.
 Create workflow documentation to accurately capture requirements, systems, and constraints that inform project development and implementation.

 WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH:

 Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent industry experience in business, information or computer science, user experience, or a related field.
 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, preferably within the technology consulting industry.
 Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a focus on building strong relationships with clients and team members.
 Experience conducting workshops, designing workflow documentation, and creating user stories.
 Familiarity with databases, technical integrations, and related software tools.
 Proven track record of identifying strategic opportunities and proposing innovative solutions.
 Familiarity with Jira, Miro, Confluence or other project management and documentation software tools.

 THE BENEFITS YOU'LL LOVE
 As a Business Analyst at Adage, you'll enjoy work-life balance with flex schedules, remote-work options, and 20+ days of paid time off annually. Adage offers excellent benefits with 85% employer-paid insurance, profit-sharing bonuses, 401k contributions, and FSA. We have monthly happy hours, quarterly social events, an annual retreat, and a great office environment with a stocked kitchen and gym.  Apply now for your next adventure delivering world-class solutions, surrounded by a team that shares your passion for helping others.
 Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.  Adage Technologies is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team that represents and respects diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skill sets. All qualified candidates that share Adage's core values are strongly encouraged to apply. #BI-Remote

About CCC
 CCC Intelligent Solutions is a leading technology company helping to improve the insurance claims process for millions of people. Our award-winning SaaS platform connects more than 30,000 businesses, including insurance carriers, repair facilities, automakers, part suppliers, lenders, and others to streamline the process from start to finish. 
Our advanced capabilities in AI, IoT, telematics, blockchain, data, and analytics drive continual innovation across our platform, as we work to advance the multi-trillion-dollar P&C insurance economy’s digital transformation. 
At CCC, our mission is to keep people’s lives moving forward when it matters most. Diversity of experience and perspective are key to our pursuit so we can deliver a future of possibilities for our customers. Find out more about CCC Intelligent Solutions by visiting cccis.com. .
 
 Job Description Summary
 The Analyst, People Analytics role is responsible for developing and executing reporting/analytics, dashboards and creating actionable insights for various levels of the organization. This role will have a solid understanding of all data points and measures and proactively gather requirements, synthesize, and consult on information and data.
 Job Duties


 Analyzes quantitative, qualitative, HR data and from a variety of sources and systems to create HR standard performance metrics and indicators
 Builds and maintains user-friendly reports and dashboards using data from various people systems that deliver key insights to the organization
 Gathers and ensures the integrity of data from internal and external sources; serves as an HR data SME and helps to determine the proper approach for analysis
 Consults on Employee Listening strategy, including survey design, approach and analysis
 Supports the facilitation of ad hoc reporting and data requests by looking for opportunities for self-service and automation
 Assists HR leadership with consulting on internal employee research and optimizing existing or new reports
 Helping partners understand key insights and working with them to develop and implement action plans leading to real business impact through effective communication and close collaboration.
 Develops and maintains reports and communicates findings to HR and business stakeholders
 Participates in team level projects focused on processes, candidate experience, employee experience, compliance, and technology improvements


 Qualifications


 Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
 2 or more years of Data Analytics experience with expertise in Excel, Tableau, PowerBI and/or similar tools
 Previous experience in Recruitment, Human Resources or IO Psychology is preferred
 1 year of experience working with HR Analytics data is preferred.

 About the company’s Commitment to its employees:

 CCC Intelligent Solutions employees are part of an inclusive culture that brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Our team is defined by our values of: Integrity, Customer-Focus, Innovation, Diversity & Inclusion, and Tenacity. 

Together, we help our clients and each other achieve new goals. 
CCC is committed to providing employees with opportunities to advance their careers and skillsets. CCC team members receive access to training and education reimbursement is available. 

CCC offers competitive compensation and generous benefits. Health insurance, PTO, 401K, are just some of the benefits available to team members. 

Each team member plays an important role in the company’s success and each team member has a voice. CCC employee engagement and job satisfaction ratings consistently exceed industry norms – underscoring the value CCC places on its employees.

What You’ll Do at BTS
The greatest ideas in the world will die on the vine if not properly implemented. At BTS, we turn our clients’ ideas and strategies into results. We do this by designing customized experiences that drive innovation, alignment, and performance.
As a Business Analyst consultant on the Strategy & Business Modeling team, you’ll work directly with leaders from the world’s leading corporations. You’ll learn their strategies and how their businesses work, and you’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of their senior management. A BTS consultant also cultivates the skills of thousands of developing leaders across the globe.
A Strategy & Business Modeler (SBMer) is responsible for designing and building the business simulations and models that are the foundation of many BTS experiences. Our excel-based models help leaders at organizations visualize their role in their company’s strategy and understand how their decisions impact organizational performance.
The SBMer is a key member of the BTS consultant team that conducts discovery interviews with client stakeholders, co-creates a design with the client to deliver on their objectives, builds the modeling component of the experience, and delivers, facilitates, and presents the end solution to the client. An SBMer brings specialized knowledge to the BTS team by helping to simplify complex business models, highlighting tradeoffs within the client’s business, and bringing strong business and financial expertise to the team. The SBMer is also expected to be a trusted advisor to the client by co-leading interviews and milestone meetings as well as joining client facilitation teams. ,
There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you will have all the variety you want in your clients and work. You’ll be staffed on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams.
We feel that regularly working together in the office is the best situation for career development, and so we are not hiring remotely-based employees at this time. However, we have a hybrid work environment where you can work from home a few days a week. As for travel, we do that when we are in front of our clients leading them through BTS experiences and workshops we’ve created. And as we continue getting back to “normal,” you can expect that you’ll travel around 25-30% of the time, going to different cities to facilitate the incredible experiences you’ve designed.

What We’re Looking For
Curiosity. Resourcefulness. A humble and inclusive spirit. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.
Strong business and financial acumen and a love for problem solving with a structured approach to scoping solutions to those problems. Advanced Excel skills (INDEX/MATCH, Lookups, IF statements) are a must. Modeling skills, as well as experience with programming languages, especially VBA, are big pluses. Backgrounds in engineering, finance, science, math, or economics are well-suited. We have team members from all kinds of backgrounds, work experience, and education. We love diversity and variety.
We do have a few requirements. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is needed, as are strong written and verbal communication skills. Willingness to travel as indicated above.
Lastly, we require eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship.

Title: Salesforce Business Analyst
Location: Chicago, IL, Peoria, IL or Dallas, TX
Duration: 12+ Months
Job Description:
Position’s Contributions to Work Group:
Looking for a team member who is energized by learning about the business and business applications within the Salesforce platform. We need a team player who wants to jump in to get the job done and lead. This role will have primary responsibility for working directly with business partners to create, analyze and validate business requirements, translate them into detailed functional requirements, solutions, user stories, acceptance criteria and test cases. The incumbent will be responsible for creating user stories, defining dependencies, impacts and acceptance criteria, and obtaining requirements sign-off from business partners.
Education & Experience Required:
8+ years professional exp in writing technical requirements and/or Technical Business System Analyst for Salesforce, preferably Service Cloud.
Technical Skills
(Required)
5+ years professional experience.
3+ years developing, supporting and/or managing Service Cloud/ Salesforce Development requirements.
2+ years of experience with the Agile methodology.
Experience managing projects using Agile software tools such as DevOps, JIRA.
At least 1 Salesforce Certification such as Certified Advanced Administrator, Certified Sales Cloud Consultant, Certified Experience Cloud Consultant – Multiple preferred
Experience working with onshore/offshore team model.
(Desired)
Experience in Service Cloud/ Salesforce components to recommend and lead business units to solutions.
Soft Skills
(Required)
Strong accountability, planning, organization.
Demonstrated ability to proactively lead and empower teams, communicating appropriately to ensure a team’s success.
Highly developed interpersonal skills to deal with sensitive, emotional or potentially controversial situations.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Typical task breakdown:
The typical day could include any or all of the following types of work: Translating Business Requirements to Technical Requirements
Document and validate business requirements for an application or process.
Work closely with business partners for clarity on requirements, gather and understand technical problems to identify solutions.
Proactively seek input from relevant areas of the business that should have inputs to this application or process. Influencing Solution Design
Solution discovery to provide technical guidance and assist in solution design options to Super Users, Product Owners and Business Owners.
Develops solution for major system modules, programs or infrastructure released based on requirements gathered from the business.
Configuration or customization expertise in Salesforce
Validate solution design, including prototyping and configuration for an application or process
Assist customers with usability in solution design.
Establish security data classifications for the application or process.
Establish and document business rules for the use of an application or process. Leading Development.
Represent the customer and customer experience, interfacing and engaging with the customer .
Responsible for conveying the vision and goals at the beginning and throughout the sprint
Lead developers and quality assurance resources throughout the build cycle, clearing any doubts about the solution, addressing ambiguity and providing direction.
Create and groom user stories and communicate backlog priorities to the team.
Assists with the elaboration of epics, themes and features into user stories that are small enough, or granular enough, to be achieved in a single sprint.
Competent to perform programming, development, integration and system administration assignments.
Participate in sprint planning meetings, daily meetings, scrum reveals and retrospectives.
Inspect the product progress at the end of every sprint and accept or reject the work that has been done by the development team.
Provides Salesforce system administration leadership, guidance, and assistance to other team members. Testing and Training for Application.
Develop, review and approve test plans as required by new content releases or deployments for an application or process.
Conducts customer acceptance testing, from both a technical and business perspective, and coordinates testing with additional business users.
Review and approve end user training materials and documentation for an application or process. Act as “Face” of the Salesforce to the Enterprise.
Represent the application or process with other areas of the business who use or integrate with this part of the business.
Business escalations point for any conflicts or concerns with the application or process.
Responsible for working on and driving complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift support calls.

    Reporting to the Director of Performance Improvement, uses various systems and data gathering tools to prepare and disseminate reports, charts, to analyze trends related to the continuum of care.  1. Works with the Director of Performance Improvement utilizing a variety of databases and data gathering tools to provide information to help drive or evaluate patient care. Generates reports designed to assist in improving safety and quality and reducing costs and improving the efficiency of providing care. Utilizes system resources to blend various data sources and prepares reports including charts and graphs using data to demonstrate trends; presents data at appropriate meetings to identify areas of opportunity for improvement. 
   
 2. Extracts data from multiple internal sources, and interacts with a variety of hospital departments based on requests for information and as instructed. Meets with management and/or requesting party to determine data requirements. Compiles data, reviews for accuracy, and formulates presentations and analysis of data for various teams as needed. 
   
 3. Prepares and ensures accurate routine statistical data; extracts data and verifies accuracy of data; utilizes data to prepare summary tables, charts and graphs to be used for planning and assessing organizational effectiveness. 
   
 4. Uses a variety of data sources to prepare dashboards or ad hoc reports. Completes departmental monthly statistical reports. Assists in and performs various special projects and leads in data gathering and abstraction for current trend analysis. Compares trending and values to baseline and/or previous time period data; notifies management of variances; researches and rectifies variances. 
   
 5. Participates in specified committee meetings and initiatives. Provides agenda, handouts, contacts members, prepares and distributes minutes as required.

 7. Adheres to all Northwest Community Healthcare standards, policies and procedures.

 Bachelors degree or equivalent in a clinical discipline, statistics/biostatistics, data science, or science
Experience working in health care or a health care-related field in a position requiring database management preferred
Interpersonal skills needed to interact effectively with clinicians including physicians, nurses, and others in an academic medical center
Collect data and maintain database(s) for stroke research projects
Maintain and improve a database evaluating stroke clinical performance in order to guide process improvement
Maintain and improve a quality metrics database to identify and facilitate clinical review of stroke patients
Analyze databases and summary reports, identify trends in clinical performance, and perform statistical analyses and data visualizations to help understand the magnitude and potential factors influencing these trends.

Facilitate case updates for allied clinicians including Emergency Medical Services, referring physicians, and clinical care teams

 About Northwest Community Healthcare In January 2021, Northwest Community Healthcare (NCH) joined NorthShore University HealthSystem, which is now NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health. The NCH Arlington Heights campus features a 509-bed hospital with a Level II Trauma Center, Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit and a dedicated pediatric acute care center. Throughout the northwest suburbs, NCH has 23 doctor’s offices; five immediate care centers; seven physical rehabilitation sites; and 13 lab locations. NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health is a fully integrated healthcare delivery system committed to providing access to quality, vibrant, community-connected care, serving an area of more than 4.2 million residents across six northeast Illinois counties. Our more than 25,000 team members and more than 6,000 physicians aim to deliver transformative patient experiences and expert care close to home across more than 300 ambulatory locations and eight acute care hospitals – Edward (Naperville), Elmhurst, Evanston, Glenbrook (Glenview), Highland Park, Northwest Community (Arlington Heights) Skokie and Swedish (Chicago) – all recognized as Magnet hospitals for nursing excellence. Located in Naperville, Linden Oaks Behavioral Health, provides for the mental health needs of area residents. For more information, visit NorthShore.org, SwedishCovenant.org, NCH.org and EEHealth.org.
